There is a very good variety of plants, some really beautiful colours and all set out in different themes to represent different countries and cultures.
A really nice enjoyable day.

They have an amazing light show in the evenings that is free of charge. It gets pretty packed so to catch it, go early and get yourself a nice seat. The show was awesome for Christmas coz it was Christmas themed. They also have a River with glowing ovoids
Gardens by the bay are awesome. I liked cloud dome better than the flower dome. There are some amazing wood carvings, rocks and displays there. Loved it
This place is a must seen! There is the waterfall and the flowers garden. We were super lucky to be there at the holidays seasons to witness the shows and the amazing celebrations of Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Go to the Botanic Garden instead!
REVIEW_BODY: The garden itself is quite fine, although by far inferior to the Botanic Garden of Singapore. It is also much more crowded, because all tourists go there if they have 1 or 2 days in Singapore, and there are many ligth bulbs. The flower dome was AWFUL. Too many people, Christmas plastic trees with plastic decorations. I say it again: Go the the Botanic Garden instead!

The place is insane. I was there before Christmas but they already started celebrating and attract tourists. Ceremonies are going every 45 mins for 15 minutes and i would recommend to go there at night because the view is incredible. Entrance is 10 Singaporean Dollar for simple tour in the gardens. If you want to visit the whole complex, you must pay 38 dollar but you need to be there in a day because they are closing some parts of the garden after 6-7PM. Everywhere is tree and botanic. Very easy to access by metro and you can find a lot of signs whos here so you cannot get lost. I was really impressed and wasnt expect that good. If you want to go up in the trees you must pay another 7 Dollar inside the garden. This is seprate from the enrance fee. Food is kinda cheap but beers are expensive. There is also a food court inside the garden and a lot of options. So you wont be hungry. Prices are cheaper than the market/.

Beautiful attraction located in the heart of Singapore next to Marina Bay Sands. Contemporary artworks such as floating eggs in the pond and fascinating vegetation. The highlight of our visit was an impressive music and light show on the known Supertree Groove. Visit the gardens during the evenings around 7:45 to enjoy the show.
an amazing place, I was impressed, the lookout at the 57th floor was amazing, you must visit this place and have a high tea!!!
The show from 7:45pm was awesome. The eggs are in the night quite funny. Skywalk is average, nothing special.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic place - but be wary of peak times
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is a stunning place and a real credit to the city. The skywalk and Cloud Forest are both excellent. We decided not to do the Flower Dome and were glad we‚Äôd made that decision as we spent a long time in the Cloud Forest.

The above was on our second visit. The first was on Christmas night and the whole site was absolutely packed. Queues for the paid attractions were incredible. We had dinner at Satay by the Bay, which wasn‚Äôt too crowded at about 7pm, and then fought our way to the MRT station. Worth noting that Google maps has a feature that shows how busy a place is, and that was saying twice as busy as normally at the same time. We should have paid attention. A useful tool.

Definitely go, but pick your time.

We spent the whole morning there. The garden offers a lot to see, both inside and outside. Amazing views and sites. For the indoor spaces, you have to buy tickets. Otherwise to walk around outside is for free. Can recommend to go inside the domes.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must do in Singapore but a little bit overrated
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must do in singapore, however if you are not a loving nature person you might find this place a little bit overrated.

Nothing to complain about. All was good. Went here with my 5 yo daughter and she had a blast. But I recommend to go here after 3pm so the weather won't be very hot and very beautiful lights in the evening.
Surely will be back again.
It rained for most of our stay but the Gardens have in door Domes that was simple magical worth every penny.
Take some time out from the busy city to enjoy the beautiful gardens you only pay for the areas you want to go in but it is beautiful at day and night

If you like nature, plants, flowers, trees & grand design of 2 very cool green houses, you must visit Gardens by the Bay.
Book & pay online to print your e-ticket, so that you don‚Äôt need to lineup to buy tickets there. The 2 very cool green house domes are beautifully presented with world class design, a lot of plants from around the world, amazing waterfall, sky bridge foot path to let you walk back down to earth (ground level) & plenty of opportunities for incredible photos of the plants, flowers & trees. After visiting the 2 domes, you should walk toward the park 2 hours before sunset for more amazing photo opportunities of Marina Bay towers. The biggest let down is the quality of food at Gardens by the Bay food centre..... Why, why, why.... get Food Republic in there to fix up the issue. We don‚Äôt mind paying around SG$15 for a meal, but the quality is below average. Sorry.

They did an amazing job setting up the plants, and, even though we‚Äôre not botanists, we still had a fun time. They also had nice holiday festivities and told a story that entertained the kids through their decorations. Limited food options though ‚Äî only McDonalds and a Chinese restaurant.
Was fun, I would highly recommend to visit here, especially at night. When we were there it was Xmas time and very festive
Not to be missed. The Gardens outside and the Domes are all beautifully done. Lovely for walks including the Marina Barrage.
Not only is a stroll through the Garden a relaxing environment for realigning your inner peace, but it‚Äôs a visual masterpiece of man-made and natural beauty.

You really have to admire Singapore government to be able to come up with this brilliant idea... tiny nation but really trying hard to plant as many trees as possible.... every bit man made, all trees transported and planted here... great planning, great maintenance and care

It‚Äôs an awesome place for nature lovers.. huge gardens.. the flower dome is awesome and so is the cloud forest with waterfall and all..!! The flower fantasy was also a nice addition. We were a little short on time and the place was very crowded being Christmas Eve.. !! One has to give this place atleast 4-5 hours.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the bay and OCBC Sky walk- one time experience
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited solo in December 2019

PROS:
- Loved the waterfall and carnivorous plants
- Skywalk experience was nice and gave a better feel of the olace
- Good place to spend time wiyh family, specially the light show in evening
- Food is awesome in the food court on the other side of bridge (unable to recall the name but you will find sign boards for guidance)

CONS:
- Christmas carnival was not at all attractive and needs separate ticket.
- Light show must have been special till few years back but now its a common thing around the world, have seen similar stuff in Akshardham in New Delhi India
- The whole experience seemed to be a bit stretched over the day, specially covering everything during day and then waiting for lights to comeon at night
- OCBC Skywalk is mostly non operational in December due to climate issues. They are very cautious and dont allow operations even if there is only a chance of a rain. The online ticket that i purchased was non refundable had they not allowed a delayed entry after arguing for one hour anf waiting for 2.5 hours
We visited the floral fantasy with a group of friends from Vietnam, we were so immersed in the beauty of the floral display and amazed with the 4D show at the end of the visit. Thank you!

Impressive light show to music. There were numerous gardens that were free to wander through. The lighting at dragonfly lake was impressive in the evening. Despite lots of people the queues for the paid attractions were well managed and so not too long. This is a great attraction for those who enjoy flowers and those with children.
Our third visit to this venue over about two years. Particularly enjoy the Cloud Forest. Great views of Marina Bay Area and surrounds from the new observatory, recently opened.

Kids loved it. Which surprised us as they had a ball.

Plant displays were amazing and well laid out.

Great way to spend the afternoon between the two domes.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great potential but experience marred by overcrowding and bad transportation management
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited during the evening to catch the light show in the supertrees. Unfortunately, the Supertree Grove was not accessible due to the a ticket Christmas fair so we could only watch from the outside. The lightshow as ok, nothing to shout about but perhaps we missed the full experience not being closer and not being able to hear the music.

We had dinner at Satay by the Bay. It was hot and smoky and my food from a seafood stall took so long to be ready that my companions had finished their food by the time mine arrived. I would not recommend eating here if you can help it.

Upon leaving, we wanted to take a taxi but unfortunately the queue was so long and I overheard a guy asking a group of tourist in front of me if they wanted to take a private transfer as taxis could take at least an hour. All of the taxis I could see were either flashing "On call" or "Shift Change".

So we decided to take a 20 min walk to the Bayfront MRT. What a mess it was, even to buy an MRT ticket. And the MRT staff who was supposed to be assisting didn't tell people in the queue that the ticketing machine only took $2 or $5 and we had to go and get a change. The MRT counter initially didn't want to assist in breaking up our $10 note, which would have left us stranded.

All in all, have your transport game plan sussed out before visiting. and plan to eat before or after.

REVIEW_TITLE: Sooo busy but beautiful at night
REVIEW_BODY: We eventually found our way in after a few wrong turns on foot (our fault). The first thing I needed to do was visit the ladies... I‚Äôm sure there were plenty on site but the block I went to had only two cubicals (one for ‚Äòsquatting‚Äô) so the queue was long. We arrived in the centre just as the evening light display started, it was stunning! Well worth the visit. We didn‚Äôt pay for any of the exhibits as it was too late to make the most of them.
Beautiful night views, too long for those with walking disability. Also, loading of photos : before can load, review already posted

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to visit, but overcrowded
REVIEW_BODY: Great spectacle but part closed due to weather. Overall, good experience, however, it was overcrowded, no etiquette or manners by some people in tour or family groups. It was Xmas but no excuse for Me Me behaviour and a family ticket 90$ is not cheap. Cafe on site good value & cheap. Expect to walk everywhere.Located near to Marina Bay Sands Hotel (MRT). Won't be coming back.

It was a magical visit to Singapore's tourist attraction, the Gardens by the Bay. With its man made, "The Falls" you will be mesmerized by its beauty. The "Cloud Forest" vibrant colors of flowers were really amazing. Definitely, a place where I can visit anytime of the year when I am also on vacation from work.

We had a Great Time here! Worth it even if you dont go inside the flower dome or cloud forest. This park is free for all, you can walk around and take many pictures. Excellent view of the city. We enjoyed strolling and looking at the Kids water park. We also ate at Satay By the Bay just inside this park. We recommend this and we want to visit again!

REVIEW_TITLE: She‚Äôs a Super Tree (to the tune of Ru Paul‚Äôs Superqueen)
REVIEW_BODY:
In a recent video, internet super-best-friends The Try Guys claimed that Singapore is what living in the future should feel like. If you want a crash course in why, get yourselves on down to Gardens by The Bay.
My partner and I are no stranger to botanical gardens, which is the most boujey thing I have ever written I am so sorry, but all I‚Äôm saying is that it takes a lot to impress us when it comes to flowers. We bought an all-inclusive ticket and, needless to say, were not disappointed.
We visited both the flower room and the cloud forest and were amazed at the level of care, information and sheer wonder on display there. We also went on the 4d motion ride, which was surprisingly a great little diversion.
Now, with it being one of the main sites to see in Singapore, the Gardens always seem to be busy with a capital ‚ÄòB‚Äô. Be prepared for crowds, but also be prepared for what can only be described as floral fireworks. You owe it to yourselves to see the nightly light shows, everyone. We saw it twice.
We walked around the gardens during the daytime and then returned that evening to witness the glorious light show, music and christmas wonderland. An amazing night out.

REVIEW_TITLE: Unreal.....done leave Singapore without doing this!
REVIEW_BODY:
This is probably one of the most AMAZING things we have done on holidays over the years. It really is fabulous. Anyone who disses it must really need impressing!
It‚Äôs it spectacular !!!
The sheer scale and size and wonderment of it is beautiful. We come from Ireland, and though my kids are well travelled they were STILL blown away by it!!!
So was I ! It‚Äôs hard not too.
It has the two domes, flower dome and cloud dome. For us we preferred the cloud dome as it had mist, height, water, flowers etc.....in an unreal structure!!! The flower dome still impresssive, but just more like really nice gardens, so I‚Äôd visit that one first. . There is more to the Cloud dome.
But the star of the show are The Super trees ... they are FAB -U-LOUS!
We did the sky walk also which is worth doing as you walk up around top of trees on a platform.
The light show is a moment I will cherish forever. We lay on the ground with our kids and looked up and this light show....it was one of those moments where I was telling myself to remember this and I said it also to my daughters. It‚Äôs not something you see everyday that‚Äôs for sure!
Just...sooooooo worth doing it. Don‚Äôt leave Singapore with seeing it !!!!!

Gardens by the Bay‚Äôs Flower Garden is a true wonderland. If you‚Äôve got any doubts then the Alice in Wonderland themed sculptures should put your mind to rest. If you‚Äôre getting the impression that it‚Äôs solely about Alice, the Hare, and the other characters, then I must say...Nay!
Alice and the crew are just one of several themes. Singapore has done an amazing creative job of bringing a variety of examples of floral ecosystems from around the world all housed under an architectural master piece.

The Flower Gardens is huge! One could spend hours exploring and losing yourself in the organic fantasy sculptures. During the Christmas/New Year holiday season there‚Äôs an entire display dedicated to a secular celebration bathed in lights that will leave no doubts about the beauty and magic of the time of year.

Singapore has a reputation for being hot and humid but that‚Äôs not the case in the climate controlled air conditioning inside the Gardens building, a plus for those of us who are impacted by heat related medical issues. The exhibit space has very wide pathways that will easily accommodate people who rely on mobility aids such as wheelchairs. Singapore has created a place that‚Äôs accessible for all.

Well worth a look & I went up Marina Bay Sands to watch the light show, was amazing. You can spend 1 or 2 hours at the garden & at least an hour or more on the observation deck at MBS. Best to to do it it late afternoon to evening

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful afternoon in the urban green
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely place, fantastic concept of bringing greens, trees, shrubs, cactus from all over the world to be shared with urban tourists, locals who may not have any chance to visit the actual locations where these greens are found.

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely plan a full day for this place
REVIEW_BODY: Heard so much about this place, seen it from the roads. Finally made it to visit but it was so crowded that we couldn‚Äôt visit one of the place we purchased. Get there early so you can see all the different attractions. The new one has to purchase ticket at the attractions. It would be nice to be able to purchase all the tickets from the ticket office.

This place is so amazing and beautiful. Especially at night where I would say is better because it's all lit up. We visited twice here. Some of the Gardens are free to walk about anyway. We visited Winter Wonderland at Christmas time too which was spectacular to say the least! We also did the skywalk to get a different perspective during the day.
Got last minute tickets for the Gardens by the Bay. Very impressed. Well organised and lots to see. If you love gardening, you must visit
It was a Christmas program lights and sound. Enjoyable. Visited the gardens of Mediterranean, Africa and so on. However did not have that much time. Recommend keep at least 3 hours to see all.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best thing to do in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
There is a lot to do in here. So come preapared to spend some serious time. There is a light show every night. They had light show for Christmas going on when we visited, very nice light show.
Garden itself is very big and you can spend hours here just roaming around. There is a very nice meadow, a Chinese garden and an Indian garden. Every section of the garden is very well maintained.

My husband and visited the gardens in March before boarding a cruise from Singapore. They are beautifully laid out in areas of the world filled with luscious plants. It‚Äôs well run and easy to navigate. If you go early evening there‚Äôs a free light show which is magnificent. We‚Äôd purposely planned our trip to start in Singapore to be able to visit the gardens and weren‚Äôt disappointed.

We heard that the beat time to visit it was in the late afternoon or early evening, so we went there at around 5. The gardens are well kept and the cloud forest is amazing. The food, satay by the bay was fantastic(we had satay and chilli crab). But it was an absolutely nightmare to get a taxi to return to the hotel. We had to queue up for more than an hour to get the taxi. The other option was to pay more to get a taxi( S$50). We refused. We were miserable by having to wait too long. Singapore added a bitter taste to our trip. Too crowded. Only if you are willing to pay more you can get the best services. Everything comes with a price.

Lovely Poinsettia X'mas at Flower Dome. Cool stalls and lovely choruses at X'mas Wonderland. Lightshow and soap snow was cute too.
Too bad the layout was poor as e-ticket holders can only exchange for physical tickets at a booth at the Visitor Centre, despite the different entrances stating 'online tickets'. Super uncool to have to traverse from the Meadow all the way to the Visitor Centre in the rain. Also uncool that diners cannot enter Supertree Grove without the X'mas Wonderland ticket.

REVIEW_TITLE: plan to spend several hours and too much money
REVIEW_BODY: We bought the double attraction tickets to the flower dome and the Cloud Forest. There was a line to get into the Cloud Forest Dome but it was only about 10 minutes. It kept moving. We were so excited to get in and feel the cool air and see the massive waterfall. Then we started walking inside and realized there was another really long line. We had no idea. So we waited about 50 minutes in a line to get to the elevator. The line keeps moving and you are walking along pretty flower beds as you wait in line, but it's a FIFTY minute line. No way to use stairs to go up. We contemplated NOT waiting and going up but we are SO glad we did. The views and walkways from the top are really amazing and just seeing the stuff on the main path at the bottom would NOT have been worth the money. As it is, it's a really expensive way to see some flowers. Many cities have botanical gardens for a few dollars that are just as beautiful. I'm glad I went ONCE, just to see it. But I'll never go again. Not for that price. Not too mention, the super long line inside the Cloud Forest dome made it so we didn't have enough time to do the Flower Dome. So money wasted. We also bought tickets to do the walkway. We bought the tickets about 4pm. And then went back about 6pm to get our "assigned time" which happened to be 7:40 which was awesome because we were ON the walkway during the 7:45 light show. The walkway was really fun and totally worth the $8 price. The line to use the elevator was short and easy, since they assign times (after 5pm they start assigning times on a first come first serve basis. you can get in the line to go up the elevator at your assigned time. It makes it really doable. But need to buy tickets a few hours early!!!) . They light show was really fun and the views were incredible and we all really enjoyed it. When the light show finished everyone was hungry for dinner so we went to the foodcourt place right there at the super trees. It was PACKED! It took some in our group 2 hours to get their food. crazy! During that time we were able to step outside and easily see the 8:45 light show from the ground. Really fun to see from the ground also. I do NOT recommend going to the foodcourt anytime after 7:30. The food is mediocre and pricey and the place was a madhouse! If we didn't have hungry kids with us, we would definitely have just walked and found something else. It's a really fun area to walk around and explore. Lots of nice walking paths. Great in the evening with the cooler weather and all the lights and buildings and water. I'll go back to the area to walk around and enjoy the paths but I will NOT pay for the domes again and we probably won't do the walkway or light show again. Once was enough. It's too crowded. Definitely take water and eat elsewhere. We did refill water bottles using the drinking fountain near the bathrooms. We walked there from Chinatown. 30 minute walk or 27 minutes on metro. So we walked and it was a really nice walk!

Amazing place, so many things to attract. The lights are very colorful the greens are good in the eye. Very crowded but fun and the dancing music light was really amazing and the fireworks. This place are good to recommend for family and friend.
You need to be reasonably fit to visit here . It‚Äôs worth a look though . Take water with you . It‚Äôs very hot walking around .
Christmas decoration this year looks so gorgeous. I really surprise with a lot of beautiful views. Worth of doing sightseeing

We visited on Christmas eve 2019 for the Christmas light show. All i can say is that it is a massive security hazard waiting to be set off. There were throngs of people trying to leave at around 8 with lots more trying to get in via one staircase from the Gardens to the bridge leading to marina Bay Sands through one set of escalators down to the shopping complex. Just imagine the chaos if there was an incident that triggered a stampede.

The show itself was nice but a bit repetitive. We werent told the ODBC skyway was closed at 4 so we would have to come back another day to that. The Flower dome was a bit ordinary but the Cloud Forest was great with fantastic architecture. The Skyway itself was short but we were fortunate to visit during a solar eclipse so spent time up there watching the eclipse. It's certainly unique enough to visit once and tick that off your list. Not sure it warrants repeated visits.

Getting to Garden By the Bay may be easy. You can either take the MRT (Downtown Line or Circle Line) and alight at the Bayfront station. Then you walk along the connecting walkway linking to the Garden By the Bay (there‚Äôs a lift). Then buy tickets to Flower Dome and Cloud Forest if you want and take a stroll to the venue. With a stroller, I recommend the Flower Dome but not the Cloud Forest as the queue for lifts can be long. Then you can stroll to Satay by the Bay to have some satay. It can be really crowded on weekends and public holidays. Then walk to Supertree Grove to watch the night lighting show (please check the time). The show lasts for 15 minutes. If you watch the last show at 8:30pm, please take note that it is very challenging to catch a cab when the show ends. For express taxi in order to avoid queue, you will be charged $30 to Marina Bay Sands, and other destinations $50 which is ridiculous. To avoid that, take a stroll and locate Silver Garden and then cross the link to Marina Bay Sands for Bayfront MRT Station.

A must visit when you‚Äôre in Singapore. Avoid the long queue for tickets by purchasing online in advance. It is ideal to print out the tickets too (as they will need to stamp on the tickets).

Cloud Forest & Flower Dome:
If you buy tickets for this combo, you‚Äôll able to enjoy it for the whole day. You could also do re entry for both venues. Just make sure to get the re entry stamp at the exit. You‚Äôll spend 45mins to 1 hour minimum at each dome. Remember you can come back to visit these domes for the whole day.

Super Grove Trees:
You will need to get the tickets separately from the Cloud Forest & Flower Dome. You‚Äôll spend 45-1 hour here depending on how long you plan your visit. If you‚Äôre shooting a pro photo, it may be longer.

Flora Fantasy:
This is a separate exhibition and no re-entry is allowed. There‚Äôs a 4D Show before you exit. You will spend approximately 45 mins to 1 hour here.

Team Lab showcase:
This is showing currently till March 2020. You will need to ride on the shuttle to get here. You can purchase at the ticket counter for 3 dollars per person. Get a stamp as you are able to ride the shuttle for the whole day.

Tips:
Go early morning so you can enjoy the venues at slow pace without many people.

Go on weekdays if possible. Weekends are usually very crowded. In general, this place is very popular.

Grab Car or take a cab if you can. No need to struggle to get a parking if you‚Äôre driving in the island. This place can be quite competitive to score a parking at peak hour.

If you‚Äôve re entry stamps for Cloud Forest & Flower Dome - you can come back in the evening. You will be able to enjoy TeamLab eggs lights and also the music show at Super Grove Trees.

Hope it helps. Enjoy!

REVIEW_TITLE: Family with elderly and young children
REVIEW_BODY: It is a nice place for family with elderly and young children. Other than seeing plants from different regions there are also many spots for photo taking. Good for both knowledge and entertainment. Highly recommended!

We spent a fantastic couple of hours in the early evening to late watching the lights come on and just walking around the gardens. Absolutely beautiful and serene. Lots of people but everyone seemed also to accept that the experience was special and not a lot of noise. Most just sat and watched each of the light sculptures come to life. With the Marina Bay Sands in the background it was really beautiful.
Truely recommended

REVIEW_TITLE: I love the lights at Christmas Village
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is huge and I didn't have time to see everything but the lights and decorations at Christmas Village wowed us all.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens light show to music wonderful night
REVIEW_BODY: Very magical and lights show to music on a beautiful evening excellent gift shop splendid too can just stop and watch and listen

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for a day trip
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens, must visit if you are in Singapore. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes since there is a lot of walking!

You will need half a day to walk round the gardens.
You have to pay extra for some things though.
The water fall was lovely.

Floral fantasy 4D ride is really worth watching, my girls love it so much. The newly opened Supertree observation desk is below our expectation. The sheltered observatory floor is blocking a lot of the views due to its structure.
It was Fantastic. I wish I spent more time but was in a rush. The super tree is a must visit. I'd like to go again at night. I'm sure the views would be spectacular!!! Definitely recommend

The gardens are a must visit. They are filled with the most beautiful and well kept flowers. Grounds are spotless and staff are very friendly and knowledgable about the gardens. Plenty of gift shops and places to get food a drink, although it was on the pricer side. Hours could have been spent at the gardens looking at the beautiful displays they have. It is an attraction like no other I have ever seen and would highly recommend. Very easy to get to by taxi.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to Cloud Forest & Flower Dome
REVIEW_BODY: It was a good visit. We especially enjoyed the visit to Cloud Forest. The orchids there were very beautiful and many of them we saw them the first time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best Place to Visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is easily the best place to visit in Singapore especially during the Christmas period. However you need to pay to get into the Christmas Wonderland (carnival games and christmas market with the main decorated structure) but it comes with fun and performances too.

Beautiful gardens, varied displays, thought provoking themes, amazing design
Fabulous few hours spent here. Plenty of options for food and drink
Well worth a visit

Very beautiful gardens to see even if you do not go into the domes: they are spectacular. Nice play area for the kids. Take the bus rather than the MRT because the approach through the hotel is interesting and you get a great "first view" of the towers.

REVIEW_TITLE: Christmas at Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: The Christmas music and snow machine was great for visitors of all ages. The aerial bridge was the highlight of the night, we enjoyed seeing the view at this height and listening to the Christmas music. The food and home made crafts were fun to browse.

If you‚Äôre in Singapore, this is a must-do. Free entrance, with lots of paying attractions within this park. Best time is around sunset to enjoy the 19:45 PM (free) light show. The park itself is a lush green oasis in a bustling city. Totally enjoyable and recommended!

Gardens by the bay , is a rejuvenating refreshment to the eyes and soul and breaks any negative bias associated with the term 'Gardens' you might have.

It has two paid parks Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. The Former is a manmade representation of how forest in Amazon grows, beautiful, falls, mists and walkway created to give you a feel of what it could be.

Flower Dome is a collection of various flowers , as do exist in a typical garden but with a modern feel.

Besides there's a OCBC skyway, good for a one time visit but reach before sunset if you want to have nice photos. However the associated laser show towards end of day ( 2 timings) is really interesting.

There's a lot of free area associated with Gardens by the bay which is a very nice 2 hours walk to the Gardens and a good day visit to locals. If you are visiting Singapore for a short time, it can be completely skipped.

Not being a plant or garden person I wasn't sure if this would live up to my expectations but it exceeded them! Absolutely amazing place to visit and such good value. Lucky enough to visit over Christmas break so Christmas theme kept it interesting for Miss 9! Went to both Flower Dome and Cloud Forest and highly recommend both.

I hadnt done much research so was blown away by the set up of these gardens. The architect is to be commended. There was a great variety of plants displayed in all kinds of displays. The air con domes were a welcome relief. Went to the 4D show which was unique. I liked going on the boardwalks to see display from a height. Stunning arrangement on rock face with waterfall. In all, I loved it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Try to go there at night
REVIEW_BODY: We were there day and night. Day time was very hot, we bought the ticket for the train ride which run through the whole garden and was beautiful. We went back at night again for the music and light show, it was free and really beautiful. Check their website for show time.
Excellent for a half day of flower-admiring. Of course, the place is VERY crowded, but we thought it was worth it!

We walked over the helix bridge to get there which apparently a lot of people miss! It‚Äôs a very beautiful structure.

At the gardens, barely any lines if you‚Äôre there at 10am.
We bought the pass combined for these attractions with included shuttle (which is so worth it on a hot day). Floral fantasy had the nicest flowers but cloud Forrest was just amazing especially with the mist going. Flower dome was also nice but my least favourite.

Bought separate ticket to the new Supertree observation deck on the first day it was open. don‚Äôt forget to go to the rooftop! Best views in Singapore because you can see the sky deck and super trees, Ferris Wheel and harbour. You don‚Äôt need to do the other Supertree walking path as the views are similar but not as high.

Good selection for lunch at the food hall including gluten free options at the Vietnamese.
We walked back over through marina bay sands and filled in the rest of the afternoon walking around marina bay. A big walking day but a great way to see the area.

We came back that night to watch the super trees light show. It was amazing. You also don‚Äôt need a ticket to enter the park and watch the show. Tip, watch from down amongst the trees themselves!

Recommended for a great day.

it is a great Christmas event in Singapore..although to go to Gardrns by the Bay in mid November to 26th December have to pay for entrance tickets in the afternoon till night..but the decoration and the blizzard moment combined with the garden raphsody is a beautiful magical view that you don't get such experience everytime..so once we have to try it..beside there are others activities like theatre and playing games, and a lot of famous food stalls we can enjoy..

Such an amazing place to visit. Spent hours here. From early morning to evening. Seriously beautiful and gorgeous. Lovingly looked after from the living giant metal trees, the tree top walk, dragonfly sculptures, to the big floating baby to the wonderful and varied plant species. Magical place worth every minute wondering through all the different global garden designs. Then to top it off the spectacular light show. Just the icing on the cake.
I really love this place. Offers plenty of different types of flowers with state-of-art facility. Highly recommended.

Two gigantic domes packed with plants & trees from around the world. We were lucky enough to see the Christmas display.
We were in each domes for 2 hours, so much to see. An absolute credit to the staff who design and maintain these stunning displays.
Allow yourself plenty of time to appreciate these popular attractions.

One of the best tourist attraction in the city and it's one of the main reason I'm here in Singapore. The garden is a huge complex consisting of two domes, the famous tree grove, and also small gardens representing a certain culture. The most popular ones are the domes, tourists should definitely experience both. The tree grove can be seen from a far (if it's enough for you) or wait until dark to see the light shows. Admission price is expensive but definitely worth the money.
What a beautiful place and you can get some awesome photos here. Be mindful of the indoor waterfall as there is a lot of spray and the conservatories are a bit chilly. A great concept though!

The minute we entered we asked the information counter about hiring the buggy or if shuttle services were available. There information desk clearly declined nothing as such is available and we have to walk all the way. In the end when we were visiting the cloud dome we saw the shuttles operatoring and the buggy rides also on rent. Highly disappointed because of this.
Other wise the Gardens are beautiful to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Crazy busy and a bit of a yawn
REVIEW_BODY: This review is aimed at westerners who are fortunate enough to have travelled a bit. We were less than impressed with the domes at gardens by the bay. The flower done was basically the plants we grow in our garden (which are not native to Singapore) and the cloud dome was mildly interesting, but the crowds and wait times put us off. The free and public gardens did look like they were worth time and we would have gone back for an afternoon if we could have. We were there on the Sunday before Christmas and the crowds were unpleasant. We did see the Christmas display at night and the super tree light show which was impressive. If I was advising visitors, I would recommend finding out the slower times and I would question whether or not the domes are worth the entry fee. The super trees are worth seeing at night and the public park looks excellent. If you want to see indigenous plants, however, the botanical gardens are more likely to please.

Visited the Gardens by the Bay at Christmas time....
During the day it was a visit to the Flower and Cloud Forest Domes, which were really impressive.
Then a return in the evening, when the light show was the main attraction.
However, as it was Christmas time, there was an additional benefit of the Christmas lights...and the general fun and merriment of the occasion.
Well worth a visit, at any time of year.

Was not expecting much but was very pleasantly surprised. A great variety of different types of gardens, all cleverly laid out. Lots and lots of photo opportunities. Was here at Xmas and many of the displays were xmas orientated which i found excessive, but i am sure others would have liked it. Best buy combined entry with the Cloud Forest.
Love it so much! Amazing water fall and love the nature conserved! Best part is you get to know lots of plants & lego session. Amazing!
Beautiful and Amazing lightshow in the evening. Also beautiful at Day time. Beautiful garden surrounding the place. You can also have a picnic with you family. Only say Beautiful place. Must visit.
This place was the highlight of my trip. Absolutely stunning gardens. Cloud dome was most impressive with it‚Äôs beautiful carvings mingled with the beautiful plants. Don‚Äôt miss these attractions.

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Dome and Rain Forest dome
REVIEW_BODY:
A wonderful Airconditioned man made nature paradise that gives you the feelings of being in several countries all at once.
Beautiful blooming flowers and landscaping with descriptive panels adds to the learning journey.
Highly recommended to visit

I must admit that I only had a couple of hours to explore this beautiful work of art, and so I skipped the Flower and Cloud Forest Domes (which had fees to get into) and I chose to explore the free gardens. The Gardens were thoughtfully created and all the lush greenery was just soothing to the eyes. The Supertree Grove was definitely amazing. I just wish I had more time to walk around and go up to the OCBC Skywalk. Definitely wear your most comfortable walking shoes which is a must for any sightseeing tour of any city. This Garden is huge and you'll have to walk everywhere to fully explore it.
We visited the gardens during the day and liked it that much we went back that night for Xmas carols and the Xmas lights. Very easy to access via the train network service.A must do in Singapore.

Absolutely phenomenal. The cloud forest dome is a must see. It brings together a stunning display of gardens and waterfalls with a powerful message about advancing sustainability, reducing environmental degregdation and tackling climate change.
This place gets busy and it might pay to get their early. Wonderful displays of gardens from all around the world in climate controlled domes.

A nice calm relaxing place, fresh in the middle of the humid warm weather, which caught my attention from my point of view as there is a mega engineering project in pro of the atmosphere. People can go for tourism, learning, exercising, relaxing and more.

We only visited the Gardrns at night, but they were spectacular and a must see for Singapore. Would definitely recommend the Sky Walk, great views over the city and a chance to get up close to the Supertrees and have a look at the engineering.

Soo much to see. Don't go on Xmas day. We were packed in like a tin of sardines. The ques were soo soo long. Took over an hour to get a taxi back to the hotel. Xmas wonderland was amazing. The cloud forest was stunning. So was the flower dome. Beautiful waterfall. Enjoyed the walk above the forest. Best to go at night to see all the lights.

Nice place it is the best place to visit in Singapore it has many types of flowers in flowers dome you can see many rare types of species and cloud forest is one of place ever body will like there we can see carnivores plants

The gardens by the bay are a must visit in Singapore.There are several attractions inside the gardens like the flower dome and the Supertree grove.

We primarily arrived late in the evening and hence only visited the supertree grove.

The Gardens are reachable through the MRT or by walk from Marina Bay Sands or by cab. There is no entry fee for the garden itself but charges apply for some of the attractions inside like the flower dome and the OCBC skyway.
It is an absolutely must do when visiting Singapore! The light show starts at 8:20pm and the skywalk bridge closes at 9:00pm. It is a 15 minute or less wait to go up.
A must see in Singapore. MRT station is close by and aesthetically the entire park is beautiful. There are a la carte tickets for the different domes and the skywalk. A super experience.

Singapore is unique and popular touristic destination, and for Christmas they presented real Christmas dream with all those lightings, fake snow, Christmas music and decorations by the trees. I was amazed and charmed. What a great experience to visit the city before Christmas ü•∞

Really interesting exhibits and plantings especially in the Flower Dome that must not be missed. The 4D Flight of the Dragonfly experience is great for all ages!.
Different themes presented all through the year - the Christmas displays were spectacular.

REVIEW_TITLE: Its good but not enough seats/places to sit
REVIEW_BODY: I love coming visiting the 2 domes. However, there aren't enough places for the elderly to sit and rest. Especially during peak times. There also not enough seats outside the domes to sit and wait. Its not elderly friendly.

REVIEW_TITLE: Supertree Observatory- another nice attraction within...
REVIEW_BODY:
We have been to this place few times over the years, each time seeing certain attractions located within the Garden.

This time , we just strolled along the gardens in the cook weather - never gets tired of this beautiful garden.

There is a new attraction that opens today called Supertree Observatory & there is a promotional package being offered now.

Will visit this new attraction in next visit.
Together with the Christmas Celebration. It is simply awesome theme. The decoration and lighting is beautiful.

$Sing 45 might seem a little steep at first,but as soon as you walk into the first exhibit you‚Äôll realize it was great value. The place is stunning. Only piece of advise is give yourself a minimum of 3 hours to do the place full justice.Maybe visit late afternoon so you can also enjoy seeing everything illuminated.

It's a very beauty park suitable for family with young teen. There's many different culture elements to be seen there.

If you plan to visit the garden in the cloud and the flower garden. Try to arrange to occupied one whole day.

The place is a bit hot during noon and the rain can fall in a blink of an eye. So an umbrella is a must have item.
The gardens are another marvel constructed by the singapore government to let people enjoy a beautifull location within the city!
This is a must see! I am not a big garden person, but I loved it! Amazing how much their have under the glass domes. Plus, a great place to escape the heat!
Very nice place, we had a fantastic time with our 5 yr old. We also visited the flower garden and the cloud forest which are also amazing. Need a full day to visit all.

Is a very nice and huge flower dome. They change theme occasionally. During our visit was a Sakura flower.
Must visit cloud forest just opposite of the flower dome.

Words really can‚Äôt describe this place, you must see it to understand its beauty.
So many photo opportunities, if you take the time to wander through the gardens and look outside the usual tourist photo
Spots

Well maintained & creatively crafted gardens attract a good number of tourists all over the year. Within Gardens by the bay, you can see 3 major attractions Flower dome, Cloud forest and Supertree Grove with OCBC skyway. All attractions are worth seeing and recommend to visit the place at twilight so that light show at supertree grove must not be missed.
If you want to see the Gardens in details you may have to free yourself for at least 4-5 hours.

We‚Äôre there 2 days before Christmas Eve , a Sunday evening, and it was unbelievable crowded. We had to pay 10SGD for the Christmas market entry fee, which would have been ok if there would not have been so many people!
Pretty and worth the trip. Playgrounds good. Take swimmers for kids to play in water park. Nice views back to the city and Marina Bay Sands.

We went to the gardens on a Saturday evening so it was slightly crowded but these are a spectacle for free. We didn't avail any paid attractions but it was very good. Our 2 year old daughter enjoyed the childrens park/water park very much and we had to literally pull her out of there. Lol.

This is not really a place for garden lovers, more a theme park for family interest. The information on what was happening , where to queue, etc was very limited. We went in an evening just before Christmas so it was very crowded and we decided that the queues for the domes were too long. However the evening light and sound show was worth coming for. The BotanicGardens would be a much better visit for serious gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Christmas 2019 at Gardens By The Bay
REVIEW_BODY: The decoration this year is very bad compared to last year.. And the snow is little.. Everyone was expecting it to be everywhere around the Luminarie light sculpture. So Dissapointed. Other then xmas carol.. Bring up some good performance like example dance.. Come on singaporean can do better. Such a let down
This is my second visit and it‚Äôs obviously nicer to visit in December. Don‚Äôt worry about transport as they are very efficient so you can get a cab after queuing for a short while.
It‚Äôs definitely a must to at least visit tourist attractions once in your life time. Garden by the Bay is one of the nicest garden/fortress you‚Äôll ever see!

Garens By the Bay is the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen. They are well designed for maximum eye catching pleasure.The flowers are well maintained and are changed with the seasons. Singapore doesnt really see seasonal changes as it is in the Tropics but the flowers here represent the whole world and how that changes with the seasons. It really is worth visiting.

These are not to be missed. But tix online ahead of time to avoid inevitable queues. While the exhibits inside are very cool, the fun is outside when the Trees are lit up. During Christmas season, you‚Äôll hear cheery seasonal music as you stroll and enjoy the beautiful lit up giant trees.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing place in an urban setting!
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore really is at the forefront of trying to fight the negative impact of climate change. Having a park-city environment is one goal but also educating everyone of the precious flora and fauna is a great way to make that point. Gardens by the Bay is amazing, indoor setting, spacious, and filled with beautiful exhibits of flowers and trees.
Thank you Gardens By the Bay Singapore for providing me with such a great experience at the place! Look forward to come back again!
First of all, the place was very cooling. There is a huge variety of flowers to see, a great place for photography! Additionally, they have special decorations for different occasions.

Truely an amazing place! Beautiful flowers, plants with spectacular lighting and light show. I would recommend spending some time during the day looking through the domes and enjoying the light show at night. Well worth the visit. Highly recommend.
Meal was dreadful. Certainly not vfm. Eat somewhere else. Chicken was plastic ally in both taste and texture. Oh dear, dear dear dear........
You have to see it to believe it! There is so much to see by day and night. Well worth the entrance price.
Very interesting gardens but was disappointed with the light show which was just changing colours. The Marina Bay Sands light show is far more spectacular.

This is a very cool place to go to. One its one of the most iconic places in Singapore so you must visit to at least take a photo. Walk the path and see the gardens and then you can pay to go in the flower gardens if you want to. Short taxi ride from the city and then you can walk back through Marina Bay Sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good environment ruined by bad planning/management
REVIEW_BODY: Went for Christmas Wonderland 2019. Deco and atmosphere was fine, but the process to get the tickets were troublesome. Although tickets were booked online, still had to retrieve physical tickets at a gate that was a 15 minute walk away from the MRT exit. The counter to retrieve the ticket was not even obvious, it was merely a long table with 2 staff to hand it out. (pity the 2 staff members sitting there) Thankfully staff were helpful and friendly, it was just bad planning on the management level.

Gardens by the Bay is a treat any time but it is special at Christmas as the evening lights come on at the Super Tree Grove. The high waterfall upon entering the Cloud Forest immediately creates a cool and exciting experience. The trip to the top of the mountain and down again has many surprises and treats. Lots of photo opportunities!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great night time attraction for everyone
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely brilliant. A vibrant, colourful and interactive experience that is suitable for everyone as there is a lift and ramp to walk on. Staff are friendly. There are two domes, the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome, as well as a light show that runs at night. Might need to take a jumper even in summer though, as the air conditioning is very cold!

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place to visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Best place to visit in Singapore. Feel loved and blessed to have watched the beauty of mother nature.
Waiting time was more then 1 hour for conservative dome. It was really regretting to visit Gardens by the Bay
2nd time at Christmas Wonderland! Crowded but managable and beautiful! Just that the rides and games are too expensive.
very good! A good place to calm down. Very interesting and good that the visitors got sensibilised for sustainablity.
Worth every cent . An oasis in midst of travel chaos. Easy well signed. Kids loved water play and the domes were a sensory overload. Great break from humidity too.

It would be better if the gardens be opened till 10pm. Enjoyed the variety of flowers. Would be good if food operators like macdonalds have more seats and more counters given the huge crowds of people who visit the Gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to garden by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Nice visit with my friend and uncle. I would like to have a guide in my next visit and I would like to spend more time in each and every place. Totally it was nice experience
Love the Gardens by the Bay. Give yourself sufficient time to view all of the attractions. Easily accessed via the MRT, take the shuttle if it looks like rain. So much to see and experience.

We have been to the gardens by the Bay twice. We visited Flower Dome, Forest Dome, and Super Tree. The Flower Dome is amazing flower arrangement. The Super Tree offers good outdoor views on the Sky Walk. The Forest Dome has the indoor Waterfalls. I recommend three hours minimum for the garden.

REVIEW_TITLE: Way over rated and upcharge for everything
REVIEW_BODY:
It's a pretty basic greenhouse walking tour with tree and plant, and christmas lighting and decoration, at a scale that's smaller than the indoor portion of most botanical gardens in the US, and Macy's alone has more Christmas lights and decoration than this. In fact, there are many houses that have more lights and decorations than this place. Our group basically started comparing which of our hometown streets have better decorations.

The Skywalk has a nice view, which is really the only photo-worthy part of the entire place. For something this small, they charge separate tickets to see each one, which irks me even more. For those who have traveled to other countries and seen bigger, you will be sorely disappointed.

Gardens by the Bay is a must see tourist attraction. If you visiting in December, the Christmas atmosphere will get you into the festive season. The gardens are an absoloute delight to walk through in the night and make for awesome photo moments that you can reflect on for a life time. Entrance fees are keenly priced and it is definitely worth the admission and the time even if you are on a tight schedule. If you visiting in the night, it might also be an idea to dash off to the nearby light and sound show as well. Make sure you co ordinate the times so that you can get to enjoy the gardens and then the sound and light show. The gardens are epic and a must see... enjoy...

Excellent place to visit. We were lucky that we visited there on just around the Christmas. It was all having a lovely Christmas theme. Otherwise also, beautiful place to visit.
My suggestion is to visit there by late afternoon, so that you can finish it after the sunset, during which it is more admirable due to the spectacular lighting decorations.
We were little disappointed in the Flower Dome as apart from few varieties of flowers, rest everything was just green and green and lots of varieties of cactus. Nevertheless it was still good to see all that.
Cloud forest is one thing you can‚Äôt miss. Beautifully made and with a tall man made water fall.
Later in the evening, you can visit the tree groves and if u like can have a walk on the sky bridges which connects the tree groves (OCBC Skywalk).
Ince you finish there, just walk over to the other side towards the Marina Bay Sand Hotel. Have a stroll and shop if you like and enjoy the Fountain Show on the river side of the Marina Bay. Two shows daily at 8:00 pm and then 9:00 pm
Overall it was a good visit and we enjoyed.

REVIEW_TITLE: Be sure to visit the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest
REVIEW_BODY: There are very nice gardens to walk through, but the highlights are the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest. Be sure to go into both. I think they were well worth the entry admission price.
Unfortunately the weather wasn‚Äôt great- pouring with rain and the Christmas markets meant some of the park couldn‚Äôt be accessed without paying. Well worth a visit but in good weather

REVIEW_TITLE: Great to walk around and enjoy the nature indoors
REVIEW_BODY: When visiting Singapore this is a nice place to visit and walk about, enjoy the plants and views. It is extremely well maintained and as with pretty much everything in Singapore - so clean.
Going to Gardens By The Bay is nice for people who are fond of gardening.. There are many varieties of plants.. Many places are their to visit

Visited on a rainy late afternoon/evening in November.
The rain was no problem as we first visited the indoor gardens the best of which was the Cloud Forest. This is a huge high dome with living walls and walkways high above the main waterfall and an amazing collection of rocks with various crystals embedded in them. The other indooor garden is floral fantasy which was decorated for Christmas with every type of poinsettia you could possoibly imagine which came as a bit of a surprise to us!

After the rain stopped we were advised to head to the Supertree grove for the free nightly sound and light show. This was a fabulous 20minute show featuring popular opera tracks such as Nessun Dorma and was a very moving experience for us. We then walked back through the park and caught a taxi outside the famous Marina Bay Sands Hotel, a wonderful first evening in Singapore

$8 for the walk is more than worthy, however a couple queue in front of me & 2 ladies queue behind me found that they do not have ticket, it was a Long queue to access the OCBC skywalk bridge (entrance), they discovered that they need to buy tickets at a ticketing booth 30 metres away, too bad, they have to go buy ticket & queue again.

So tourist, buy your tickets first.
I wonder the management can do something about ticketing information.

7.30pm light show, best enjoy on the ground, avoid go up to the OCBC skywalk during that time.

The view on the bridge was breath taking, however, the bridge has only 80 people capacity, there are sign to tell tourist keep to 15 minutes stay so others have chance to enjoy the view too.

I was there on 22 Dec 2019, 8:40pm was just a nice slot after the light show. However, my holiday mood was spoilt by a very rude female staff keep yelling ‚Äúkeep moving forward‚Äù, (not even a please). Most of the tourists were standing therefor less then 10 second right after we came out from the lift. Anyway, hope we won‚Äôt have to meet her anymore for the rest of our holidays.

REVIEW_TITLE: Garden By The Bay By Night
REVIEW_BODY: It was a blessing in diguise. Due to heavy rain. We had to skip watching the lion's dance performance at Marina platform. At around 6.45pm we left the place and walk to the GBTB. Wow heavy human traffic at the entrance. Queuing up like a snake. We decided to walk outside the garden. Moving slowly at our own space & explore the garden from different angle. What my camera capture were amazing scene from different angles and I am not someone whom is easily impress of what I had seen but this spectacular image that I had captured changes my mind. Free view n every corners that we walked is making my camera wanting to capture all that is happening. Spacious surrounding,very good for couple, family and friends, tourists and making very cents worth visiting this place. I spent about 1 1/2 hours moving around. If you have time buy a ticket n enter the Dome which I haven't try myself. My friends all very impress with the landscaping at different occasions n will try one day. You can also watch my Youtube video where I had uploaded one or 2 videos on GBTB n others nature walk around SG n some of cooking recipes at C Z (with a lion head)or ask for request to join in my instagram at charlene zhuang. Give a thumbs up or comments where I can improve my skills.Below are some of the pictures that is swallow by my mobile cam and hope you like it.Bayfront MRT station is where you should b alighting and have your diner first before walking. Carry a small drink bottle around. Food wise not really sighted unless you are at the Dome where a small cafe n a ATAS restaurant, souvenir shop. Enjoy and whatever I had stated here is all my personal opinion.

No wonder, it call the Garden City or City in the Garden. Must visit if you are in Singapore. Many restaurants or food court available. Needless to say about high end shopping at Marnina Bay Sands.
Don't really recommend Casino, as it is really expensive.

A day well spent at the gardens.

I would recommend the cloud forest. It is a beautiful walk and offers great views of the Marina bay Hotel, singapore flyer and the city. The misting of the mountain was a bit disappointing, but the waterfall was beautiful.

The flower dome was disappointing, they had a great display of Christmas decorations,but the flowers were limited. I wouldn't recommend spending money to see this.

The floral fantasy had a vast array of beautiful flowers, but it was a short expedition. The animation at the end was great, especially for young children.

The shuttle service is helpful, especially if elderly are travelling but it is manageable to walk from the entrance to the 2 indoor garden areas.

The gardens do allow free access to certain parts, but you have to may for the cloud forest, flower dome and floral fantasy. Shuttle service and OCBC walk also requires payment.

I would recommend a full day to take your time. Alternatively is can be done in the afternoon with the viewing at night which is spectacular.

Next time I would start with Flower Dome and after that I would go to the Cloud Forest, which from my point of view is more interesting.
From OCBC skywalk you can have a look on the whole garden.

We only had 2 days in Singapore and after researching decided this would be the place not to miss. It‚Äôs easily accessible by the metro and was well worth the visit. It is a beautiful and unique place and you only pay for the extra areas to choose to visit. There is a food court serving different countries food which is inexpensive. We stayed for the free evening light show which was set to music and quite spectacular.
Everything is beautiful in Singapore, at least what we visited. Even kind of mess at Little India looks pretty cool. The Gardens left us speechless. No comments here..

December is a very rainy month. Pack an umbrella! If you enter these domes, bring a warm jacket, they were really cold.
- the gardens are well done.
- very easy to access by public transport
Gardeners paradise. Very enjoyable experience. Lots to do and see. Good place to take kids. Spectacular in the evening.
Such a beautiful and peaceful area. Loved every aspect of it. No fault, was surprised to see how it was always so clean. Definitely worth the visit. Be prepared to spend a couple of hours.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit when you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Very beautiful garden with lots of things to see. Suggest to come here in the afternoon, and you should go to other domes in the garden first and make the Supertree Grove the last stop as it looks much more beautiful at night, in my opinion.
I absolutely loved gardens by the bay, especially the cloud forest dome! This is seriously not to be missed.
A ‚Äòmust see‚Äô when in Singapore! Allow at least half a day to see the beautiful displays. Best time to visit to visit is in the morning.

Visited in the week before xmas so the effect of the 'trees' was spoilt by an overload of neon chtistmas lights. Qued for aound 30 minutes to experience the walkway which was beautiful, particularly as we were lucky to be up on it just as the light show started. It is a strange but lovely instillation and quite reasonably priced to experience.

My family and I had come here with very high expectations as we have never been to anything like this. We enjoyed ourselves very much but we were disappointed when it came to the Cloud Forest. Throughout the 2 Domes, there weren't many flowers. The other thing that made our experience bad was the waiting time for going up to the Cloud Forest was 50 min+.Be prepared to "snake"around queues of people.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Splendid Must See Attraction in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The way this Attraction has been designed, it exceeds the expectation of the visitor. Flower and Cloud Domes are simply a treat to the eyes. The skywalk is a great thrilling experience. Evening lighting is again a must see thing. Overall, great value for money
Definitely a must do, more mesmerizing at night time. Tickets are required for specific areas but the garden can be explored enough without a ticket.
Always a lovely place to visit and on this trip we enjoyed the sculptures and Christmas light show. Wear sunscreen and a hat as it gets hot in the sun! Easy access via Marina Bay Sands.
Definitely worth a visit to see these amazing biodomes. They feature unique plant species from all over the world.

This huge place is perfect to see a variety of plants from all around the world. The temperature is maintained to match a certain climate, under two huge domes ! Be sure to take your jacket with you, it can be cold under the dome. This is a place to see in Singapore !

Inside the garden are two domes - Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. In Flower Dome, you can see many kinds of tropical plants but in November it was beautifully decorated for Christmas. There were so many arrangements I lost count. Cloud Forest was spectacular, especially the Lost World. The waterfall is also spectacular with sunlight glittering and reflecting everywhere.

Visited with friends,and omg-it was magical.It is green everywhere,flowers smell amazing and everything is so clean and in place. We went in the night too...light spectacle is so so beautiful.Singapore is one of my favorite places in the world for sure-it has everything for everybody.

Singapore does live to its name of being a garden country. I am so glad that I‚Äôve got to visit this piece of paradise on Earth. The view is breathtaking. The scenery was so refreshing. Come in the evening to enjoy some light shows. The festive season also brings the Yuletide spirit with their dress up pines.

It mainly consists of two parts‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîFlower Dome and Cloud Forest.
In flower dome, you can see many kinds of tropical plants which are fascinating to savor. There are also some animals living in rainforests ‚Äî‚Äîmade of wood unfortunately.It was an enriching experience for me to learn about tropical flora and fauna.
Cloud Forest didn‚Äôt fail to give me the mystery. I felt like an explorer discovering the pristine rainforest world.Here are caverns, cloud walk and the Lost World‚Äî‚Äîthat‚Äôs so beautiful with sunlight glittering and reflecting on the waterfall.Some movies about environmental conservation are also provided inside.
Remember to bring a water bottle!!!
I was dying for water while I had to put water I couldn‚Äôt drink (the sea, the waterfall and pools) into my sight.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must from dawn until dusk
REVIEW_BODY: We had a fabulous day here despite not being plant / garden people. So much to see and smell. The light show at night finished off an amazing afternoon.

What a beautiful experience. The large crowds were a bit hard to take, but the gardens and light spectacular was amazing!! Well worth a visit. The cloud dome and super trees are well worth the price, however we were a little disappointed with the flower dome - even though beautiful, it didn‚Äôt compare to the others.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the marvels of Singapore...
REVIEW_BODY: One of the marvels of Singapore. A bit expensive, but worth every penny. You can visit the garden for free, but have to pay to enter the Domes....

The attraction is free unless you want to see the light show, which I really recommend $10 each, plus another $10 if you want to walk the tree line - again well worth it at night to see the lights .

This is a fabulous place that has lots to offer everyone, there are food and beverages and a gift shop, however going in December when the lights are on makes it really special

Loved Gardens by the Bay, everything is showcased in a spectacular way . Domed Gardens with beautiful plants from around the world, amazing huge wood carvings, waterfalls, orchids and the light show at night was a joy . Definitely go again.
Absolutely amazing place to visit. So much to see and experience. While you you walk around you are trying to take in so much .

Defiantly good value for money, some very interesting displays.
Give yourself at least two hours to be able to see all the plants

We went there at night to watch the light show at night and it is pretty amazing. I really love the colours and the trees and plants there. It‚Äôs just a pity I do not have more time to spent at this garden. I believe you will need to spend at least half a day or even a full day at this place to truly appreciate and see all the things to be seen here. We just spent a couple of hours there mainly to see the light show which starts at 8pm.

This place is just opposite of the Marina Bay Sands. There is a tunnel that you can walk over from the MRT station at the Marina Bay Sands. The name of the station Is actually Bayfront.

Highly recommended if you are in Singapore. You will enjoy the night lights at the garden for sure.
Very well done. It is a marvel for a small island country. The high walks are superb but not for those with balance problems. The controls are good also. We spent about 4 hours on a slow tour

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Dome and Cloud Forest package
REVIEW_BODY: We took the shuttle ($3) from the Bayfront entrance to the two domes. The Flower Dome was decorated with Christmas d√©cor which provided a nice festive atmosphere. The Cloud Forest was impressive, not so much the waterfall but in terms of its design, and it's hanging garden. Both domes are temperature controlled and can be a bit chilly in the Cloud Forest.

Went during the week and did the Skywalk during the day to avoid paying the Xmas premium ! View was fabulous. At night visited the Cloud and Flower Gardens which are extremely freezing and not as impressive as imagined. Equally please note that you MUST have done the flower dome before since they close the entry off at 8pm! A guided dummy walk through the settings we were not enchanted.

Overall you go there for the pictures not the actual content

Really worth a visit we used the metro its 10 dollars for a tourist past
Metro and buses.
We stayed at Grand Park Hotel.. ORCHARD Road.

As soon as you step inside your lungs start feeling better, your nose recognize the wonders of nature and suddenly green becomes the most important color.

This not only give the city a new air but reminds everyone the importance of nature and the damage we do everyday.

This is a megga expanse of a nature park, it covers 250 acres of reclaimed land. It is located in Marina Bay and houses a plethora of different types and designs of gardens.

We visited here a couple of times during our recent visit to Singapore, once was not enough. One visit was during the day when we visited the amazing Supertrees Grove and the OCBC Skyway.

We walked by the Dragonfly Lake and then crossed the Dragonfly Bridge into the Supertree Grove.

The meadow is a vast expanse of grassland it is 22,000 square metres. It is Singapore's largest outdoor event garden. It is home to a number of statues/sculptures including the Floating Baby.

We did not visit the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest, these are 2 domed enclosures within the Gardens. The metal and glass structures are a feature of Singapore's skyline.

The Flower Dome is the largest glass greenhouse in the world.

There are a number of other attractions within the Gardens, such as the Silver forest, Golden garden and the Large Floral Clock.

On Tuesday evening 24th October we returned to the Gardens to watch the Garden Rhapsody Show, reviewed separately, admission is free

There is so much to do and see here by day and by night, absolutely fascinating. Access to most of The Gardens is free, however there is an entrance fee for the OCBC Skyway, Cloud Forest and Flower Dome.

We were in Singapore some 10 years ago and they just started on this project. What a excellent place to visit. You must put this on your bucket list. I don‚Äôt know enough words to explain the beauty here. Go see for yourself.

REVIEW_TITLE: Saw the Lights & Sound show on Saturday night.
REVIEW_BODY: Lights and sounds show was very crowded but was totally enthralling. Music and lights were perfectly co- ordinates.This was a highlight of our visit, Well worth seeing.

totally dissappointing. no indication of where the entrance starts. not driving friendly routes. after we parked the car no indication on where we should proceed to the main gallery. the place is nice but $32 is totally high priced. please be more realistic in pricing. its just christmas songs and the shows were absurd.
Awesome set up for the X‚Äômas wonderland , it does feel like Christmas in Sg , the moment you stepped into the set up. Great job to the organizer! Cheers

We spent half a day in the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest and they were fantastic. The Christmas decorations in the Flower Dome were amazing. The wood carvings and sculptures were amazing. The vast array of plants and flowers were just stunning.

We took in the two domes, succulent plants and rainforest plants. It is the best collection of these plant types I have ever seen! The succulents were fantastic, so many varieties from all over the globe but as good as that was, the rainforest with the spectacular water fall just blew us away! Fantastic orchids, elephant ears, bromeliads and so much more. Well worth the entrance fee! The only downside was the restaurant food, expensive and not as good as we expected.
This is a must do whilst in Singapore. We had a great visit and the area comes to life after dark with beautiful lights.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not worth the price of admission
REVIEW_BODY: We just did not enjoy this exhibit and felt it was overpriced. We were surprised when we walked in and found a large area was devoted to desert plants and cacti, since we expected tropical plants.

Really nice light show with classical music in giant trees. No costs, free entrance.

Don‚Äôt forget to bring your foto/video camera with you!

Note:
And the Chinese and Indian garden are also free.
Loved the Gardens by the Bay. So much to see and to do. Also, so much to eat at Satay by the bay.. it's worth getting the shuttle for S$3 and you can jump on the off going to the dome.
So beautiful and truly amazed by the lightings of the giant trees... a MUST go when you are in Singapore!

Really it's a something amazing and unique
The Garden near marina bay sands hotel
You can see all greenish in worldwide

This is a must visit if you are in Singapore, the majority of the park is free you will only need to pay for certain attractions (check the website for details). So much effort has gone into making this place unique & beautiful.

The cloud forest & flower dome are incredible as are the super trees. The air-conditioning inside the domes is very welcome :)

It was so lovely we went back in the evening to see it all lit up!

Absolutely loved the gardens! Singapore has done a phenomenal job on making this park. The Christmas market was on during our visit. Cute little vendors with lots of food and nick naks to buy. They also have a ‚Äúsnow‚Äù show at certain times of the day. People loved it! We‚Äôre from Canada, so it wasn‚Äôt a novelty for us. Lol.
Great photo ops at night!

We have taken 46SGD (38SGD+8SGD) tickets for Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, Christmas Wonderland and OCBC Skywalk. IMHO, you can opt to skip Skywalk as it is for only 15 minutes and view is okayish. Cloud Forest is chilly and you should bring a jacket/muffler with you. At least you should visit both conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest).

Really enjoyed walking around here. So much effort has been made in the design of these unique attractions. The park is free to walk around but we also paid to enter the floral fantasy where there were many photographic opportunities. Very impressive. Recommended.

We visited all the different gardens and found them quite stunning. The air conditioned domes are very welcoming. Being Christmas time they had excellent displays of Christmas around the world. The water gardens are nice to roam around as well. Be there on dusk for the transformations as they come to life.
..on a 1 month tour and have possibly seen a highlight on 2nd day..stunning place that portrays gardens beyond belief..

Great way to spend a day. We went to cloud forest, flower dome, and ocbc skywalk. The two conservatories are beautiful. Without giving too much away, as you walk into cloud forest, you are treated by a 30 meter waterfall before descending through the conservatory exploring various plants, crystals, etc. Flower dome was equally impressive and houses 9 different worldwide gardens featuring countless plants.
Unfortunately floral fantasy was closed for maintenance the day we went went, but that just gives us something to look forward to next time.
Pro tip: if you plan on visiting all 3 with a family of 4 or 5, it may be cheaper to buy a family plus membership for 119.

REVIEW_TITLE: Save your money. Just take pictures and don‚Äôt go to the conservatories.
REVIEW_BODY: The price is too steep for these conservatories. The flower dome has barely any flowers and nothing that a free flower park can‚Äôt give you the satisfaction of. The cloud forest is cool but on its own, not worth to pay the money. Also during my visit, i bought the pack together with the ocbc skyway. They have an event and it was either pay 20 dollars more or nothing. Their answers were that I should have known to come before 3pm or come the next day. I am leaving tomorrow and certainly don‚Äôt have a time machine to turn back time. The attitude of the people sucks and i surely won‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone. Disappointed, upset, tired. NEVER AGAIN

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place wile in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Awesome place one must see the show at .7.45 PM the light show. Breathless.............. The garden was out of this world, if given a change I would love to visit Gardens by the bay.
If you love flowers, plants, flora - you will love it here. The flowers changes every 3 mths so it's different every 3 mths you visit.

We recently visited Gardens By The Bay experiences the two domes flower and cloud along with the sky walk.
The flower dome was set up for Christmas with an amazing display and also fully air conditioned which was great given the humidity of outside. The displays were varied and well set out with character hidden through out each section.
Cloud dome how refreshing and cool that was the force of the water fall was surprising and amazing, the walk through was well set out going through each section before heading up to the top of the waterfall there was a short wait which we were well informed about before we even entered the dome they said 30 minutes but it was really only 15. The high walk down the water fall was slightly congested at some points that was more to people suddenly stopping to take photos.
We did the sky walk at night after the first light show, though I hate heights it was a view not to be missed, they limit the numbers on it and you have between 15-30 minutes to complete the walk giving you plenty of time to snap some amazing photos.
Highly recommend gardens by the bay both domes and the sky walk, the free light show was also amazing.
Nice place. It was before Christmas, lighting was awesome. For Christmas they installed a lot of children ride I side. Just beside merina bay hotel, light show was great as free entertainment.

Excellent and enormous indoor (air conditioned) greenhouse with very nice garden displays. A little bit contrived but overall a good spot to relax and enjoy many types of flora. Weekends can be very busy which can take away from the overall experience. (our only complaint)

We skipped the flower dome. We peered in to see if we missed anything....we didn‚Äôt

REVIEW_TITLE: An impressive collection of flowers and plants from all corners of the world - like a little globe in (a big!) Miniature
REVIEW_BODY: As one of Singapore's absolute 'must', a visit to one of these two giant botanical gardens indoor domes is a memory of a lifetime! Here are plants from all over the world and you wander around the different continents, which are divided into different sections or planes, but very informative and easy to see signs.
