REVIEW_BODY: If you have any interest in gardens and plants, this is somewhere not to be missed, the views looking at the 'mountain' of plants and through the glass dome toward the surrounding gardens and city are spectacular. We were more impressed with the Cloud Forrest dome than the Flower Dome, so if you get tickets to both, go to the Flower Dome first.

Cloud forest is amazing and very well put together (from professional rainforest botanists). We were lucky to be there mid-week, so not super-crowded. Crowds can be issues on weekends. Floral dome likewise impressive. Good way to spend a day

REVIEW_TITLE: The night light show on the Supertrees is worth the money ...
REVIEW_BODY:
We arrived an hour or so before sundown and the experience was one we'll never forget. How they keep tropical plants and trees there is beyond me. The floral fantasy and flower dome attractions were spectacular.

One particular highlight of the visit was the cloud forest and its amazing waterfall feature.

Once the sun had set everyone waited for the next Supertrees show, we were not disappointed as we had a prime spot on the walkway bridge between the two larger trees. It truly was stunning and worth the wait and the money.

A must-see attraction if you get to visit Singapore.

Not really a well developed gardens. Sparse. Have to pay to go into specific areas. Bit of a gimic. If you want to see gardens go to the botanic gardens instead otherwise save this for night light views.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely gardens and amazing structure, and shelter from the weather.
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing gardens, amazing architecture. I believe they refresh the displays regularly as my in-laws were there earlier in the year and it was different. Great escape from the heat or rain under the dome.
I am not even interested in plants but this place is just fantastic and beautiful. Absolutely worthwhile visiting

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see and stay for the light show
REVIEW_BODY: This is an incredibly beautiful area of Singapore and a must see attraction. I recommend arriving about 5 as it closes at 8. You avoid the heat of the day it are able to see the light show. Floral fantasy is just stunning

REVIEW_TITLE: Love Green? Then you need to come here.
REVIEW_BODY: This is amazing and beautiful green house and it is almost going back to nature. Firstly we will be welcome by tall and cooling waterfall after a killing hot day outside. Then you can go to the rainforest area and others, you got to come to experience the green and others amazing not to mention if you are lucky enough you will meet an Orang Utan.
Allow plenty of time to walk through this wonder garden reflecting the many countries and their gardens from around the world.

This is our first time to the Gardens by the Bay- what a wonderful place to go for all ages. There is literally something for everyone,from toddlers to the elderly who are less mobile.We spent a couple of hours here, but could have taken all day to explore-there are audio tours available to take you around if you don't want to walk (in what we call a dotto train) and maps in all languages if you simply want to take your time. Everything is within easy walking distance and there appear to be bicycles available to hire as well.I loved the bayside position, and the view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel rising up on one side of the gardens.The gardens are clean, spacious and varied.There are several ticketed areas, but each appeared well patronised and popular.We felt we did not have time to see them as we had other priorities and were limited for time.There are also refreshment areas- including McDonalds for the budget conscious.
This is definitely a place to come back to.
Worth spending the day here, a beautiful walk around visiting the domes and trees. There is a place to eat which is reasonable. Lots of room for everyone.

I missed going into these 6 years ago and was waiting to get back to Singapore to visit - I'm glad I did, beautifully maintained and stunning. The two domes offer a different experience and when walking into the Rain Forrest one with water fall its a sight to behold. Plan on spending more time than you think as the inside seems bigger than the outside. They are constantly replacing, manicuring and maintaining so I imagine anytime of the year is as good as any other.
A must see, simply out of this world. Make sure you visit in the night for the light show as the place is lighted up like an enchanting forest
What a sight! Anyone who visits Singspore should take some time to visit this breathtaking place. It will be a unique experience. Pls don't miss it.

The MBS Gardens By the Bay are a wonderful place to spend a hot and humid afternoon in Singapore!! The rainforest Cloud Garden has a great indoor waterfall and nice and cool breeze!! The flowers and tropical plants were wonderful to look at and many photo opportunities.. Enjoy!!

REVIEW_TITLE: One could easily spend the whole day at gardens by the bay.
REVIEW_BODY: spent a whole day and it was quite simply the best day of the whole trip. recommends visiting the 2 domes in the morning and afternoon hours and then head to the supertree grove and ocbc skywalk in the evening and watch the garden Rhapsody show at 7.45 and 8.45 pm.The garden is otherwise open free for everyone.
It's really beautiful, but be ready to walk a lot. Also, when we were trying to leave the signs were a little bit confusing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent place to spend time - beautiful and relaxing
REVIEW_BODY:
Stunning domed gardens and extensive landscaped outdoor areas give a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

The night-time sound and light shows in the Supertree Grove is amazing!

I have been many times to Singapore but never visited the Gardens by the Bay. How I had wished I had visited this place earlier, it is truly spectacular with so many beautiful flowers and plants. A absolute must see location!

Didn‚Äôt do I expect that Gardens by the Bay would make such a great venue to spend the Christmas festive with my love ones. From picnic under the stars, to marvelling the gardens at high altitudes via the OCBC Skybridge (Super Trees), I would certainly recommend for first-timers to visit the gardens during the Christmas period.

REVIEW_TITLE: Have Your Greens And Eat It
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By The Bay is a fantastic way to soak in the cool crisp air in the evenings for either a good relaxing run or slow stroll. You may spot some otters!
Nice gardens and flowers. Day and night experience is different. Look for the waterfalls as it is really a good experience. Worth a chance to see the place and explore.

Literally my favourite place to visit in Singapore, the gardens are just out of this world spectacular and the work that‚Äôs gone in to them is amazing. And of course my favourite part is the orchids and the light up trees. Definitely a must see.

REVIEW_TITLE: Easy to reach to this beautiful Gardens By The Bay
REVIEW_BODY: This place is great for everyone with vast open spaces and beautiful artworks everywhere. There are shades to protect from the weather, very thoughful design from the operator. You can have panoramic view from many high points - the Marina Bay Sands Observatory and the Skywalk. Then there are the two air-conditioned enclosures - the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest, that give you an unforgetful life experience. Please expect to spend about 5 to 6 hours. I would recommend from 3:00 pm to 8:00 pm. The night light attractions are very enjoyable.
well worth a visit to see all the attractions there, night and day visits are recomended, you could easily spend 3 hours there during the day.

REVIEW_TITLE: litteraly a stones throw from the hotel
REVIEW_BODY: went for the F1 and did this in the days after the event before coming home .... really worth the effort ....

REVIEW_TITLE: The best thing in Singapore, easily.
REVIEW_BODY: Fabulous. All of it. Could easily have spent whole day there. Excellent value. Totally out classes Eden Project in UK.

REVIEW_TITLE: Our favorite place for family outing with toddler
REVIEW_BODY:
We have family plus card, which offers benefits such as 2hrs free parking, unlimited free entrances to Dome and Forest, free access to skywalk etc.
Garden by the bay is such a wonderful place for young kids to learn and play. My 3 years old like to go there every week. Either happy hours at the water park, or appreciate the exhibition in the Dome, or just walk along the river. You can spot monitor lizard near the river.
We also likes satay by the bay which offers good food at reasonable price.

The shortfalls are Forest is not so convenient for families bringing stroller. So we usually only visit the Dome, though they are side by side.
Also there is a small water playground in between satay by the bay and marina barrage, which is great for small kids to have fun. Unfortunately nearby no toilet or changing room, so you have to carry the wet little monster walking 2,3 mins to the nearest toilets to dry and change clothes. My boy a bit sneeze afterwards

This place is a must! Absolutely stunning! We suggest you go in the morning or later in the evening so you can
See the light show at 7:45pm. Walking around in the heat is not pleasant in the middle of the day! Well worth a look!

REVIEW_TITLE: reserve skywalk entrance as soon as possible and time with light show
REVIEW_BODY:
You have 10 minutes from when you get to the skywalk. This was the highlight of my trip to the gardens. I purchased tickets through Klook which was very easy to use. The dome with the waterfall had about an hour wait. the line looped for so long that we opted to skip it. We spent about 3 hours there + another hour waiting for our entrance time to get to the skywalk. We went after the 8:45 show time and the trees were beautiful at night.

I suggest to be prepared to stay longer than 3 hours especially when it's crowded and if you want to take breaks, sit down in the garden, wander around. 2-3 hours to visit the domes and skywalk.

If you have a hard time walking like I did, then buy the pass that includes the shuttle (airport cart type of transit) since it's a bit of a walk to get from entrance points to the domes.
Every aspect of this dome was amazing. Beautiful flowers of every colour of the rainbow. Perfectly manicured gardens shown in all their beauty within a very welcoming air-conditioned dome
A must-do experience. One of the highlights of our trip to Singapore. The flowers, the interactive theatre, everything is exceptional.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very well done, cooler than anywhere
REVIEW_BODY:
Such a stunning place to see and walk around, plus escape the heat and humidity for a while
Cloud garden was great
Good was amazing trip to gardens by rhe bay with fresh flowers and perfumed scents that make u fo mad
Want to get outside, aimlessly wander and see some impressive designs and gardens, then it doesn‚Äôt get more interesting than this place.
It was very interesting huge indoor flora with various plants. It was somehow paradoxical, that this artificial ecological park promotes nature protection. Anyway it was worthy to visit.

Visited this hotel and grounds on a trip to Singapore. Beautiful location on the Bay. Watched the Super Trees show at dusk as well as the light show on the Bay from this location.
A ¬´ Must See ¬ª
It's a very nice area to view lots and lots of different plants to see. A couple of levels in this place and it is nicely air conditioned so worth a visit in the hot Singapore Air.
This place with blow your mind with its size and attention to detail. Well set out and sign posted, you will find a treat for the eyes round every corner.
We absolutely loved the gardens! The artistry is breath-taking. The flowers are well looked after. We were very pleased

REVIEW_TITLE: Relaxing and Fun time in the Garden City
REVIEW_BODY: Flower Dome has plenty of variety of flowering plants and trees that is refreshed frequently throughout the year with different themes. Journey through the Cloud Forest for a unforgettable rainforest experience with waterfalls and indoor skywalk. The Giant Trees are unique and the light and music show is a spectacle not to be missed.
A really beautiful and enjoyable place to visit in Singapore! Not to miss... Lots of attractions, lovely gardens and flowers, amazing light show on the evenings.
So glad we took the time to visit the gardens again. This is our third visit and we were again enthralled with the beautiful displays

A wonderful and worthwhile place to visit if you love flowers and plants. A very pretty sight where all the flowers are so pretty and you can view them any day of the year. A nice place to enjoy nature also with all the pretty blooms. A good place to take beautiful pictures as you can see. Worth every penny of the price.

REVIEW_TITLE: Bucket list, M Brundle F1 talk
REVIEW_BODY: We attended a talk hosted by Martin Brundle, it was held at the gardens, so after we could wander around and discover the gardens

Excellent place to chill with lots of greenery and opportunities to explore and learn about the biodiverty of our planet earth. Nice ambience and great temperate environment which one does not feel like being enclosed in.
Nice time to spend quite evening with lots of good food choices to pick from. Place is well connected to other parts of Singapore.
The structures alone are phenomenal and we loved the whole creation .. definitely worth a visit and if you can see them from above too, they are amazing

REVIEW_TITLE: Superb garden which is a must see
REVIEW_BODY: I visit this garden every time I visit. There is so much to see for free including the light show at night. The two conservatories both have an entry fee for visitors to Singapore but are so exceptional that the cost is worth it. There are also a variety of places to eat.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit day and night
REVIEW_BODY:
Two different experiences. By day you can enjoy wandering the gardens looking at the natural plants, by night you can enjoy the man made giant flower light and music show.
CAUTION: - the beverages in the bar are not as good value as other places you can find in Singapore..
This is an amazing place to explore weather a gardener or not. The sights in the gardens are marvellous and the day we spent there was really not long enough to fully appreciate this spectacle.

REVIEW_TITLE: THIS MAN MADE FLORA & FAUNA IS BEYOND ANY WORDS TO EXPLAIN
REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful landscaping and a fantastic display of plants in Flower dome & Cloud forest are one of a kind in the world.

Go in October- they usually have a Halloween themed event. This place is one of a kind and though Crazy Rich Asian's did it justice, you need to go see it for yourself. The Mexican/south American edition is stunning.

its nice. great setup. beautifully done. but once is enough. lots of attractions/facilities were closed. cloud forest closed, kids water play park closed. abit of a hassle to get around. shuttle train only works to and fro the main attraction. its kinda pricey too. so just go once to experience it for yourself. or just google photos and save your energy and money for something more useful or practical like a nice dinner.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Garden that never fail to put a smile to my heart
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is a 101 hectares waterfront garden featuring over 1,500,000 plants! It is a destination that feature wonders of horticulture & sustainable architecture!

This is one attraction i visited every month, especially the Flowers Dome. Be it a good walk around the whole gardens or a leisure stroll in the Flowers Dome, one will enjoy the beautiful landscaping with unique plants and fresh air.

Admission is free for those who wants to stroll around the gardens but a small fees is payable to visit the 2 domes - Flowers Dome and Cloud Forest, and the skywalk.

I particularly love the Flowers Dome as it display seasonal flowers from all over the world. I get to see Tulips, Sakura, Dahlia, Rhododendron, etc without having to fly to these countries during my busy work schedules.

This is an attraction not to be missed. Just 1-2 hours to visit the 2 domes or half day at the Gardens, i am sure you will not regret making this trip!
Very nice tour, it was my first tour abroad,. Hotel was very neat and ,clean, travellers made good arrangement for site seen.

A fabulous place for any gardener with inventive structures and lovely flowering displays. The walk through the grounds is a pleasant break from city streets. The cloud forest is amazing as is the flower dome. The price of admission is totally worth the visit. Best to go in the morning before the heat gets too intense and then visit the cloud forest and flower dome at the end of your visit.

Since Singapore has such hot weather, good to go to a garden with air-con. Very chilling place and I enjoyed the many flowers in there. Easy to go by MRT as it's walking distant from the station or taxi for easier access. There's nice eatery in the location as well. Very impressive!

Two domes on the Marina bay. Missed the free ride around the domes by the toy tram around as we arrived a little late in the evening. First visited the flower dome. Then went to the other, Cloud Forest. Both domes are full of greenery. I would prefer the Cloud Forest with the tallest indoor waterfalls. You can climb up to the top of the waterfalls, stopping at various levels and have breathtaking views of the waterfalls from close quarters. The giant trees come alive with illumination at night. The best sight seeing tour in Singapore and and a must visit.
The Gardens are a testament to Singapore's imagination. Great family day out. There are a number of attractions in side the Gardens that will appeal to all types.

What an awesome experience. The floral fantasy, flower dome and cloud forest were all amazing. Spent several hours walking around and admiring the exhibits. There was so much attention to detail in every area we visited. Would highly recommend.

Our kids loved the floral fantasy with the 4D movie at the end. The 2 domes were also beautiful! The deal which includes the shuttle is worth it. We visited the tree walk at sunset - it was brilliant! Seeing it in the different lights and with the lights on was beautiful!

I greatly enjoyed my tour there. Loved the clouded forest.
There is also a light show there. It was absolutely beautiful.

The light show starts at 7.45pm and 9pm and lasts for about 15minutes and it is also FREE. An amazing place and experience

You need a minimum of 2 to 3 hours to tour the gardens and enjoy the experience. So plan your trip well for the garden tour and light showüòÅ

The current exhibition on RHODODENDRON really amazes me how many colors and variants there are.
The setup is really beautiful and many just can‚Äôt stop taking photos with the floral displays.
Suitable for all ages in both the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome.
Don‚Äôt forget the evening lights display!

Going to Singapore, visit to Gardens by the Bay is a must do. An amazing collection of flowers, the most beautiful orchids of all shapes, sizes and colours, places to sit and rest. one visit is not enough.
An area where to discover, smell, take some time, always refreshing and nice visit before to visit MBS or CBD. A good break, nicely done.

The giant Supertrees are incredible, mainly at night when multicolor lights create quite a show!
The Cloud Forest is also very interesting and fun to walk throughout.
The Flower Dome is beautiful, filled with gorgeous flowers and structures that add Interest.
All of it is great fun!

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place for Singapore tourists and visit often place for locals
REVIEW_BODY: Love ambiance, arrangements of plants and architecture of domes. Must visit place for nature lovers and people with interest in flora.

One of the best gardens that u can find in the world. Impressive. The super tree is beautiful with lightings of various colors. There's plenty food and beverages outlets available. Strongly recommended.

Worthwhile experience for the price paid. Would strongly recommend to come with friends or family. Within walking distance from MRT train stations. Would recommend you to have your meal before coming unless you don‚Äôt mind eating at the restaurants there. Price range is slightly higher.
This is a magnificent place right by the sea and downtown. It wasn't very expensive to walk on the skywalk through the trees and it's very close to the cable cars and mrt. So beautiful and clean.

REVIEW_TITLE: A walk through an enchanted garden
REVIEW_BODY: This place is outstanding. So much to see and so many hidden gems to stop, relax and enjoy the peace and quiet from the hustle and bustle of the Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Flower Dome @ gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY:
Take time to relax and smell the flowers in air-conditioned comfort. Going there is a breeze just take the MRT to Bayfront Station then buy a return ticket for shuttle service to and from flower dome for only $3 if you do not wish to walk in the hot sun. Every few weeks the flowers will be changed and you will get to see orchids, daisies and other exotic flowers ~ a lovely sight and a good place to take photos with friends and family.

Do visit the flower dome during your stay in Singapore ~you will find it worthwhile and enjoyable.
Visit the Gardens by the Bay at night too to get the best experience. Music is played to coincide with the light show.
A must go place in Singappre. Bring along a jacket if you are afraid of coldness. Get a yearly pass if you are staying in Singappre. Very worth it

We visited right smack at the mid Autumn festival so we got to see the paper lanterns that decorated the walk way. I have to point out there it was really crowded. By the time the Garden Rhapsody was about to start it was hard to pass as people plopped down to view. The super trees draws quite a crowd but justifiably so given that it's a breath taking attraction‚Äîjust don't order the chicken rice at the food court. Ours was frozen and raw with a whopping SG31 price tag for a meal for two! I wanted to return the whole order if it weren't for the fact we were due to line up for the OCBC Skywalk. Note that we went to all the exhibits including the newly opened floral fantasy. Lovely, lovely place to be!

Both the domes are huge and beautiful. The flower dome has so many varieties of plants which are curated in a beautiful way. Cloud forest is a must see - especially the sky bridge. Indoor waterfall is majestic and view from sky bridge is just amazing. Tip - visit on weekday and ensure that you have half a day to explore properly.

Gorgeous place. The gardens are open to all visitors with no fee, and then inside the gardens you have couple of places where you can enter purchasing a ticket. The open area includes sort of a theme gardens (Chinese garden, Colonial garden, etc) and the famous flower statues. There are also caffees and places to eat, and few spots perfect for the kids to play. When it comes to areas where you need to pay to access - there are two domes, one is the cloud forest with large waterfall coming from the top of the building and inside you have different gardens/exhibitions on each floor, so you take the elevator up and as you go down you stop on each floor to see something different. The other dome is gardens of the world, so vegetation, trees and plants from all around the world (Australian garden, Mediterranean garden, etc). There is also a flower garden which we didn't manage to see.
I'm pretty sure there is also a fee to go to the top of the flower statues and walk on the bridges from one to another - we did not do it since the line was horrifying, we would need to spend at least 45 min in line to enter.
Overall I enjoyed the Gardens, I think it's a place where you can easily spend all day. In my opinion it's something that families with kids would enjoy more, nonetheless it's a interesting and fun place for grownups as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful, but old hortus is more beautiful
REVIEW_BODY: Very well layd out. The artificial trees with light shows were a bit disney like, but nice anyway, also for children
Great place to see green, flowers, beautifully done and arranged. Second time ami visit and a must see in S‚Äôpore

Visited the Cloud Garden and it was great value for money, enjoyed the displays. Pricey for all three but plan for day and night to get best value. Station for train is closest, don't do the Marina, too far to walk.
A must see at evening time, lights changing around the garden structures in sync to a Rhapsody melody of multi language music
For sure a nice visit and something you can spare some time for. You are probably going to be in the area anyway. Cloud Forest was impressive for me and so was the lightshow in the evening.

Although having been to Singapore many times before, we never made it to the Gardens, but since everyone tells us we ought to, we finally made it. Arrived at 2.30, a good mid afternoon time, not too busy. First we bought a pass to the domes (only one was open) and the Flower Fantasy, a new exhibit. At 3pm we entered the latter, it's not too big, quite condensed with the most beautiful flowers, waterfall, frogs, etc. After half an hour or so you enter the 3-D theatre where you're taken on the back of a dragonfly over the gardens, absolutely stunning. Nice gift shop and cafe when you get out. Nearby is the shuttle, which is included in the pass, which takes you to the domes (if you'd prefer, you can walk it and see all the wonderful things on the way). We could only visit the flower dome, another wonderland of flowers and trees, nice cooler temperatures. Then a walk through the Park, some food and then finding a good spot for the evening show, which is so nice, should not be missed. In total spend more than 5 hours here and absolutely loved every minute of it.

we went to the Gardens on Sunday, full of tourists and took us more than 30 minutes to get to the elevator in the Cloud Forest. very crowded. the plants in Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are beautiful and you can simply spend your whole afternoon there admiring the plants. there is a small cafe in the Flower Dome, where you can take some rest after the walk
Everything is so impeccable and wonderfully curated, the children‚Äôs water kingdom is the highlight of the day, much needed in sunny Singapore

This place is really cool. Not only is it the site from a movie (Crazy Rich Asians- big fan) it is a real wonder to be seen. I would recommend going right at dusk where you can see it in the light and the dark. We opted for paying for the inside gardens but not the outside walk as the outside gardens are all free. Highly Recommend.
Beautiful everytime. Early morning visits (around 10am) are preferable for me as you beat the heat and the crowds.

We went there during the day so we're not abke to experience the night view but we think that it's just as beautiful! There's a lot of mini gardens, flowers, sceneries to satisfy your visual appetite. A must-visit Singapore staple!

This is one of the coolest attractions in Singapore. We were fortunate enough to have a room at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel which overlooked these memorizing trees. I felt like we couldn't stop looking at them. They are very easy to access from the hotel. You walk away from them and head around the corner. You take the elevator up to the 6th floor (its the only floor you can go to) and walk back into the hotel. You will take the bridge across to the park.

The gardens are actually a large park that is free to enter. We went at night and then went for a run the next morning to see them again. I would encourage you to see the park both during the day and at night as the park truly gives off different views. These "trees" were one of my favorite things in all of Singapore.

Spent the morning here walking around the domes and gardens, not sure if it was because it was the morning but very quite.

I wouldn‚Äôt allocate any more than half a day but nice peaceful experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: An absolute must see when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Our whole family (my parents and our young children) attended this for an entire day and the evening to watch the light display. Absolutely stunning. We all simply loved it. My mum said she had finally found heaven and didn't feel like she needed to see another thing overseas again.

A very well designed place for evening luxury. There are two parts of this place. Flower dome and cloud forest. One needs to enter and walk around this both places. Scenic beauty is very well planned and excellently designed. Kudos to the entire team for managing it flawlessly.
My advice: Plan to go there by late afternoon and then finish the two domes by evening 7:00 p.m.. later please take the OCBC skywalk from 7 to 7:45 pm. Evening musical Rendevous will start from 7.45 till 8:15. One can just relax in the lawns beside and see the beautiful music and light show.

This was a bucket list moment and didn't disappoint. The whole experience was wonderful. Yes I shed a few tears at the beauty that surrounded me. The gardens are so beautifully tended, exciting and interesting. So worth the admission price.
The best thing to do in Singapore. Easy to get to using public transport and the domes and skywalks are awesome

REVIEW_TITLE: A must vist place for tourist as well as locals
REVIEW_BODY: Really worth visiting. You could visit the super trees which are free and open to public or you could pay addmission to visit the 2 attractions. If you have time, walk to Satay by the Bay where it is a fantastic place to chill and bask in the beauty of nature while saviouring the food and sipping your drink

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit in the day and evening
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the bay were at the top of my list of places to visit during my stay in Singapore and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed.
The man-made tall tree structures look like they have come from another planet. They have an eerie feeling as you walk beneath them. But the stars are the thousands of plants growing up the structures which are beautiful and look very healthy.
It wasn‚Äôt busy during my visit in the day so the gardens were quiet and relaxing. It‚Äôs free to enter and must be a great park for the locals to chill and enjoy.
I did the sky walk and as I‚Äôm not good with heights was pleasantly surprised how comfortable I felt walking among the top of the trees. The sky walk isn‚Äôt expensive and well worth it for the views and different perspective of the gardens.
I returned to the gardens in the evening to see the light show, also free. Again I‚Äôd recommend doing this, it only lasts about 15 minutes and gets very busy but is definitely worthwhile.

Worth the hype - a great experience
Go late arvo- get skywalk ticket $8 early as it gets pretty busy
We did our skywalk about 7.30 pm great time to view the city

Visited the Gardens by the bay.

Beautifully crafted, and maintained, the gardens are actually worth a whole day visit.

Consisting of two domes, one Flower Dome and another the Cloud Forest, along with huge 14 artificial huge trees make up the lovely gardens.

The flower dome is spectacular with various varieties of flowers in full bloom along with cactii and driftwood pieces aesthetically designed. One can easily spend over an hour and lovely places for photo shoot.

The Cloud Forest dome consists of huge vertical garden full of rare varieties of foliage and trees.

The huge artificial trees too are a sight to watch when lighted. The walkway connecting the trees are ideal for photography.
Amazing to walk around. Peaceful, beautiful and heavenly scented. Regardless of age, you won‚Äôt be bored

We had a walk around at night and it was beautiful. You can also see the Marina Bay sands all lit up from the Gardens too. We just did a walk around at night, and did not go through the day but it was really gorgeous and well worth the walk.
A well manicured location which helps us to educate our children about nature n its bounties! It also draws them to the forgotten n not so fearful habitat that existed or exists
Beautiful, we did go on a Sunday so it was a busy family day and there were queues to enter the domes. The work that goes into developing and maintaining this park must be endless,but worth it
Nice walkthrough to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Casino. Tastfully arranged as almost everything in Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: A must. Go at night with a Scooter
REVIEW_BODY: Super close to marina bay hotel. Go to the light show there, than grab a scooter and pay a visit. You won't be sorry + enjoy the road
A technical ‚Äúgarden‚Äù with plenary of trees and flowers from around the world. Bonus a cascade. Perfect to visit during a humid day because the environment inside as you understand is controlled.

Of the two domes, I was most looking forward to the cloud forest. However, although beautiful and well laid out, we were a bit disappointed that everything seemed to be in pots rather than growing naturally in the biosphere. The Mediterranean dome was more natural and as a result felt more impressive. All in all, it was worth the trip.
As a side note, take a jumper or cardigan for inside. After the Singapore heat, I was freezing making my way around.

We bought tickets for both the cloud forest and flower dome. I honestly love the cloud forest more cause the flower dome was just a bunch of flowers maybe it would be fascinating to a flower enthusiast but I enjoyed the cloud forest more. The indoor waterfall was spectacular!

The facilities are equipped for the less agile and wheelchairs.

Shuttles are provided for those who do not want to walk from the main entrance to the two domes(for SGD3/person)
But if you are capable, I would suggest you to take a stroll in the garden, its amazing and there are a few pretty interesting sculptures.
The flower dome and canopy cloud are a must while at the gardens. Made sure you get to see the light show at night at the gardens during your visit.

Firstly, I didn't have time to visit the domes, although local friends say they are worthwhile. As to the rest it's a well-maintained series of spaces of which the highlight is the skyway walk between the artificial super trees (in fact air exhausts) and the views.

The downside is that this place is really busy, and you will have to queue and dodge the selfie-takers.
We have visited tonight gardens by the bay amazing! The whole experience was fabulous. The whole experience was great so much to see the most beautiful flowers I have ever seen. Truly the best
wonderful place to visit ,not to be missed during your stay, the flower dome and cloud forest very good value for money and that can,t be said very often in singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens By The Bay at night
REVIEW_BODY: Came here at 5 p.m, and wait till 8 p.m for the show, it was wonderful, the place was packed with tourist who wanted to watch the tree light show, I believe the show was 15 minute, the lights were so pretty, it was lantern festival so the lights were so many.

Gardens by the bay is stunning - we spent hours here just relaxing and enjoying the amazing architecture and the way that the flowers have been crafted and displayed. I've been here twice and will be coming back again!
This was a quick visit as we will be returning. A pleasant walk around the gardens. We will be returning at night.

Innovative and world leading, gardens by the bay is a must visit on any Singaporean venture. The Supertrees, cloud and flower installations are breathtaking. You won't see these anywhere else. Can't say enough about this place.

Fabulous place we did the treetop walk and went around the gardens very hot day but wouldnt have missed it.We also did the two domes the suprise is that both of them are cool inside where you would expect them to be boiling hot.If you stop for refreshments inside the second dome watch the prices as its expensive.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not so wheelchair friendly at Flower Dome, Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Went to the Flower Dome on Saturday 5 Oct 6pm - hubby on wheelchair. It was good that we did not need to join the very long queue but realised it was not so easy to manoeuvre the wheelchair because of the slope downwards dragging the wheelchair along and the crowd. The upper level was more greenery than flowers. The lower level was so crowded that it was not easy to get a good picture taken with the flowers, as the wheelchair was bulky. As a result, we finished ‚Äúviewing‚Äù in about 30 minutes. Exiting was an issue as we could not see the sign and ended up joining the queue to the Cloud Dome. When the usher was asked, she gave the wrong instructions not meant for a wheelchair and we ended up in the souvenir shop again, looking for an exit. Had to ask another staff again and she said to take the lift up and it took some searching through the crowd to spot the lift at the Cloud Dome queueing area. It would be great if a flyer with instructions for wheelchair users is given.
Beautiful place to know about flora across the world. Lots of walking so wear comfortable shoes.wheel chair and strollers are allowed

I love how Singapore has built such a big green park in what could be prime real estate. The combination of park with the 'high tech' trees is cool. The free show every night is cool and a must-do in SG.
In general just a very nice place to walk around both during day and at night.
Just wow! Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Super Trees were all amazing. Definitely a must do in Singapore. Go in the late afternoon so that you can catch the light show at 7:45.
Its like nothing we have seen before the Cloud and Flower domes are well worth doing my teenagers enjoyed the experience the flowers and trees and the walk truly amazing.
This is a must visit part of singapore. Its so relaxing nd so beautifully made. Everything is pefect from flower dome to cloud foresr to bridge. Worth visiting.
Great value for money, and well worth the visit. Make sure you do the treetop walk and also the Cloud. Amazing. The place is absolutely spotless.
Impressive is hardly doing it justice. The Conservatories are very very impresive and the night time illuminations have to be seen to be belived,

REVIEW_TITLE: Quick get away during business trip
REVIEW_BODY: I would recommend strolling through Gardens by the Bay. I went there in the late afternoon/evening so I was able to see it just before and after dark. Beautiful gardens in both domes.
A breathtaking experience. Never have seen so many flowers and plants with extraordinary colors. Must see is the "cloud forest", the " flower dome" and "floral fantasy"

This was a highlight of our visit to Singapore. Beware it gets very hot walking around though so would suggest to go in the evening. It is definitely worth visiting the flower dome and cloud forest. There is a light show in the evenings also but be prepared for long lines getting out.

Awesome place and most important part there is no Ticket for this. Its complimentary. Timings are 7:45 PM and 8:15 PM. Amazing light and music show without any charges. Must go with Camera and Mobile phones to capture fabulous Images..

REVIEW_TITLE: Eye will be the only witness!!
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place to visit. Everything is properly maintained. Flower Dome is awesome. Cloud Forest and scenic beauty from top upper position is very nice. Light and sound show is magnificent. Eye will be the only witness of this beautiful show.
Worth the walk across town. The Flower Dome and Cloud Florest worth more than the entry charge. The night light show great.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nature in the middle of concrete
REVIEW_BODY:
A must visit. No questions asked.

The nearest MRT is Bayfront. The tickets can be bought on the spot itself but one could look for cheaper options on the internet. The tickets are only for the Cloud Forest Observatory, Floral Fantasy Observatory and OCBC Skyway. It‚Äôs air conditioned-the two observatories.

There are enough toilets inside, so don‚Äôt worry. It‚Äôs wheelchair accessible and they have a shuttle service too but I recommend walking.

Total visit time should not take more than 3 hours. The gift shop is a tad bit expensive.
Amazing place and must visit for everyone especially nature lovers. Perfect selfie place and lots of attractions.

We visited late afternoon in order to have a walk around and to see the supertree light show at 7.45pm. The gardens are stunning and there are lots of beautiful sculptures. Entry is free and unrestricted unless you want to visit one of the special enclosed gardens or do the Supertree sky walk (we wanted to do this but couldn't because it was closed due to the rain). We had dinner at the Supertree foodcourt, which was fine (good selection and the place was clean and hygienic) and then found an elevated spot to watch the show. It lasts about 15 minutes and is pretty spectacular. The elevated spot worked out well - you don't have to crane your neck like you would if you were at ground level. Sadly we didn't see nearly enough of the gardens before it got dark so we'll have to return next time we're in Sigapore and arrive earlier in the day.

We bought tickets for flower dome and cloud forest. In the could forest, you can see waterfall. Both statiums include many kinds of plants you haven't seen before. The design of Cloud Forest stadium is beautiful. You can see the Supertree on the ground or skyway. The skyway may close because of bad weather and require ticket. The whole garden is linked to the Marina Bay Sands hotel and shopping center.

We always come to the gardens, every time we are in Singapore. Can highly recommend.
If you've never been before, buy tickets for both domes and allow a large chunk of the day
Just loved these gardens. The 2 domes were amazing but the waterfall dome with mountain and skywalk was breathtaking.

Gardens by the bay is just as stunning as it looks in the photos. The gardens itself are free to walk around, no admission involved unless you are wanting to enter the domes or super tree grove. It‚Äôs a highlight in Singapore and is a must do for any traveller. The gardens have been done with such detail and perfection. I highly recommend attending the sky tree sound and light show while you‚Äôre there. There is one at 7:45pm and 8:45pm. It‚Äôs a quite unique experience and the backdrop of Marina Bay Sands just tops it off. You will not be disappointed!

First up, it‚Äôs free! In the heat of Singapore there was plenty of shade and interesting plants and trees. It‚Äôs worth the price for the aerial walkway to look down on the extent of the gardens. The food courts was cool and had a good choice of meals.
Beautiful garden you only pay to enter the domes and the tree walk all the rest is free. Worth paying for the domes as they are truly beautiful

Well the open air gardens are free whilst charges to enter the domes are reasonable. We have been before and enjoyed it a lot both times. Currently (September 2019) some areas are under redevelopment so there is a little less to enjoy than previously, however the gardens are so big they will still entertain and inform you for a long while. Don't miss them if you are in Singapore.

Breath taking loved the cloud forest, walk way and the two domes. Purchased a ticket for these online and avoided queues. Visited again at night to experience the light and music show which is free lovely to see local families and tourists sharing the show.
One of my favourite place is Gardens. Everywhere looks peace and relaxing environment. Every easy to get there .
The grounds and the exhibits are lovely. Plan on spending at least a few hours and make sure you are wearing your comfy walking shoes.

What a vision to behold! Selfie junkies, you‚Äôve been advised......

It‚Äôs entertaining and a good walk around the garden with various sights to see and enjoy, and worthy of mentioning - no entrance fee!

There are sections where one would have to pay to view but I didn‚Äôt feel like I missed on anything by walking only on the ‚Äòfree‚Äô sections of the garden.
Next to the fact that is beautiful to visit, it is rather educational on how large cities can try to be sustainable. Did not fact check any of this, but seems to make sense.
Went with my elderly parents and young children and everyone absolutely loved it. Wonderful attention to detail.

Garden by the bay must visit attraction in singapore location is easy to reach with public transport a online ticket is cheaper then in the ticket both.
Beautiful garden better to visit in the afternoon till the light show on the the skytree
very beautiful, well organised [as always], lots of different type or flowers, fantastic place to visit

The first thing to know about Gardens By The Bay is that it is one massive tourist attraction. It has highly constructed facilities that you can pay to go into, plus it has large gardens, ponds, and even a few aquariums around the property that are offered free of charge.

For many, they find this location a great place to spend time with the family. It is also a good place to get in a little exercise and walk and/or run around.

Personally, for those of us who know what this area of Singapore used to be like... Meaning, those of us who are a little bit older, we may remember what this area previously was, once upon a time. For me, that was a much more ascetically pleasing period of time in Singapore. This is not to say that Gardens By The Bay is not a great place but I am just saying that it lacks any true Singaporean culture.

So, go here if you want to interact with a lot of tourists and see some marginally interesting tourist attractions. But, if you want to see what Singapore is truly all about, you may have to go to other locations.

I liked it here, there are a number of gardens free to view but it does get pricey if you want to step inside the domes or go on the cloud tree walk (sky walk?) the name escapes me...
Not quite full value for money but it was good to see.

Absolutely lovely place. Visited at night and it was really magical. I highly recommend visiting at night.

Love it!!!

What can you say about this. Just beautifull. Yes it is artificial but so nice to walk in specially at night when it is colder and the lights are on. Do not miss the special lightshow in the evenings.
Definitely one of the things to see in singapore

Gardens by the Bay is one of my favourite places in Singapore, and of the places I have visited on Earth, for that matter. This is a quiet spot in the hustle and bustle that is Singapore. I never cease to wonder howe they have managed to create something as tranquil as this place in on of the most congested cities in the world. The population density is almost two times as high as in London, but here you can find some peace and quiet. You can admire the fantastic profile of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and the incredible artificial trees that have become home too many birds and animals. And to top it off, you have to stay for the light show!

Loved this place. Went twice as wanted to see the light show.
If we return to Singapore in the future I will go back.

This place is everything I thought an attraction in Singapore would be, beautiful, well arranged, magical, worth every second.

We went at around 17:00 so we could do the domes in daylight but late enough to be there for the lights how and we were not disappointed.

I won't write too much so not to spoil it other than if you go to Singapore go here, you will not be disappointed, it really is breathtakingly beautiful.

Once you are done in the Forrest dome there is a video to watch as you leave showing you the impact of global warming, watch it! If you were not convinced about changes are needed you will be after it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must go to in Singapore - an oasis in the middle of the Garden City
REVIEW_BODY:
You must come and visit Gardens by the Bay when you are in Singapore!

known for being a Garden City, Singapore has really taken things to the next level by building this amazing garden with its futuristic towers that look like they came out of a sci-fic movie and also for its 2 Domes which contains what must be one of the most amazing variety of flowers, trees and shrubs in the world!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must if your a gardener
REVIEW_BODY: If you love your garden and flowers then go here it‚Äôs brilliant. There is so many to look at and very cool inside

A nice place where to learn about the bio-diversity of our planet and how we can contribute to make a better world.
A lot of nature, well preserved and at a descent price.

We loved Gardens by the Bay, we bought the Attraction Bundle which cost $46pp this included entry into the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, Floral Fantasy & the shuttle, allow at least 3 - 4 hours to look around, the walkway between the super trees is an extra $8 each but really worth it, then don‚Äôt miss the light & sound show which is on each night at 7.45 & 8.45pm under the Super Tree Grove, the shuttle is included all day, we actually went & saw the gardens early in the morning & went back for light & sound show in the evening, we went to the Spectra light & water show first at Marina Bay sounds which is on at 8pm then walked over to Gardens by the Bay caught the shuttle to the Supertree Grove for the 8.45pm show then shuttle back to the entrance & caught the MRT back to our hotel, if visiting Singapore don‚Äôt miss Gardens by the Bay it is spectacular

I love Gardens by the Bay! I will say the site is very crowded. I would recommend waiting until the crowd has left as it is so crazy when leaving after the light show has ended. But, the music and lights together is so special!!!

Stunning, free entry, we went during the day to do the skywalk and then at night from the ground, absolutely stunning, so much to see, we paid entry for the domes and it was worth every cent, you seriously need approximately 4 hours If not more and I‚Äôm not that into gardens and that‚Äôs how‚Äôs one we spent there. It‚Äôs a must do!

REVIEW_TITLE: Don't miss an opportunity to Visit........
REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay provide a 2-hour visit of joy......2 large 'domed greenhouses' - one focussed on plants and flora and the other 'clouds', focussed on Trees/Shrubs.........both are awe inspiring and very worth a visit.

I debated giving this an excellent rating, because it really is quite amazing. Perhaps the only negative thing I can say is that there were so many people, it slightly detracted from the experience. Well worth going. I thought it was slightly better than the cloud forest (although I also gave that a very good rating).

We came both during the day and for the 7:45 pm show at night. You see two different parks: the colors, structures and plants look different. But I have to say my favorite was during the night time and the lights/music show. It starts right on the sport at 7:45 and it lasts 15 min. You can sit anywhere in the park and you will enjoy it just as much. All the super trees are part of the show, and the best part it‚Äôs that is for free.

We had a day in the gardens. We purchased a ticket for both domes as well as the skywalk.

The Forest Mist dome was stunning and we spent a considerable time meandering around.

The skywalk was well worth the visit. It is worth knowing that even though you have a ticket you have to go to the ticket booth nearby the entrance to
collect a time card which indicates the time you have to report to the queue otherwise you can queue up and get to the front only to be sent away!

The gardens take on another wonder when the lights come one and the lights and music show commenced.

Must not miss a visit here

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place for a stroll away from the hustle and bustle
REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are well laid out, with easy paths to follow, with various bits of sculpture to enjoy. Various sections dedicated to specific types of plants. there is a small lake . Not forgetting the tree sculptures. These gardens are free to walk around, however you pay for the walk way above over the tree sculptures. Nice way to have a relaxed couple of hours.

Suggest you go early at 9am so that no one photo bombs your family photos or selfies.

The Rhododendron Radiance floral show is on until 28 October. Be prepared to spend at least 45 minutes in this floral show.

Suggest you wait until around June or July every year when you can buy the Friends of Gardens by the Bay membership at half price during their membership promotion period. Right now a 2 year senior citizen membership can be bought for the price of 1 year's membership. See the website for details on how long this promotion is on until.

The Food Court is worth a visit as it has a nice ambiance and a good place to chat with friends over coffee but it is a distance to walk. And food prices are more expensive than other food courts.

Gardens By The Bay at night is just a must to see!
The Light Shows that they put on in the evening are amazing!
Absolutely loved this!

If you love plants, flowers, waterfalls, trees then this place is a must to visit in Singapore.
We all enjoyed the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. I would call it the biggest and tallest glass greenhouses.
I have never seen that big in my life.
Two massive structures with full of beautiful flowers, trees, bushes from different countries. Excellent ideas.
And even the Gardens outside are beautiful.
You need to spend at least 3- 4 hours to see every thing.
Well worth the queuing. Best seen from ground level. Also worth taking the skywalk at night. The views over the city are quite stunning.

Not only are the gardens beautiful, well maintained and superbly laid out, but the walkway is fantastic.

Whenever you go, you‚Äôll enjoy it. But go later in the day and the music accompanied light show is amazing!
Well worth a visit allow at least a couple of hours. We were there for the Rhododendron Festival which was very colourful.
Absolutely a must if visiting Singapore. Take a lawn chair, blanket and watch the light show and listen to the music as you enjoy the warm night. MRT station nearby and food stalls as well. Loved it!
To get the best of this attraction you really need to visit in the evening (after 7:30 pm) when the illumination of all the exhibits really kicks in.

This was our first visit to the gardens. All I can say is if you enjoy walking round beautiful gardens and flowers, plus have an interest in photography then this is the place for you.
Our intention was to spend about half a day there. We were so wrong. It is a full day activity.
Plenty of places to reat a while and places to eat.
Would recommend this for the young and old. Family or singles

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic. Don‚Äôt miss the light show.
REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing. So much to see and do. Cloud Forest, Flower Dome, Super Trees etc. Must see at night. Catch the tree light show, it‚Äôs stunning. Worth doing the skywalk between the trees, especially after dark. Can‚Äôt rate this place enough. The two domes are amazing, so much to see, more than just plants. Amazing.
You absolutely have to visit this place, incredible to walk around. The walk is definitely worth paying for, but not the other areas unless you love butterflies etc.!

A must do on your sightseeing and allow a number of hours to do it properly. We could not get over the engineering works of the structures. The beauty of the waterfalls and the stunning gardens, plants, designs, colours...just everything...fabulous.
The lack of small sit down cafes for Snacks only, not dim sum or full lunch, is an issue for consideration - European tourist food preferences do need to be considered as well as the Asian visitors.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens By The Bay is spectacular
REVIEW_BODY:
Spent about six hours here and still did not see everything.

Spread your visit here over two days.

The cloud dome is spectacular with architecture and fantastic plants almost defying description.

The Flower Dome had plants from all around the world.

There is a food complex here but ask for directions some of the signs are confusing.

Satay By The Bay is a hawkers market where you can get beer and Satays as well as other food.

Plan your visit.

The lights on the trees and the Skywalk are also a highlight.

Stay for the show.
Amazing well worth a visit, free to walk round the gardens but you have to pay to go in the clould dome and the flower dome both worth a visit

We went to gardens by the bay on a rainy day and oh my was it well worth it. Got there just around 2 and had all the time needed to wonder around the cloud forest and flower dome as well as the super trees, it even dried up so we could do the skywalk. Well worth it, views are spectacular and well worth it, would recommend as a point when in singapore
Absolutely fantastic, what a place to visit. We spent six hours there. Must do's are the flower dome and flower dome. Great value for money. Good food court inside gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit if you have a few hours to spare
REVIEW_BODY: I visited the Gardens by the Bay during my last visit to Singapore. Granted the city itself is amazing yet the Gardens were even more amazing. The attention to detail and the beauty of everything will have me going back the next time I am in Singapore. Even if you aren't into nature, this is still a beautiful spot to tour and get a great view of the surrounding areas.

We were fortunate enough to have some time to visit Gardens by the Bay on our last day in Singapore after the F1 GP. What a beautiful place! Everywhere is immaculate, and the displays are stunning.
One thing that cannot be put across in even the best photographs is the aroma from all of the different plants and flowers as you move through the gardens and the displays in the domes. The scent from some of the flowers is as lovely as their appearance.
We would both definitely recommend a visit to Gardens by the Bay to anyone fortunate enough to visit Singapore. Make sure that you allow yourselves plenty of time there to be able to take in everything without feeling rushed.
Also, make sure that you stay for the Supertree light show that is run every evening. The show is free and was run twice every evening at 1945 and 2045 when we were there in mid September.

Absolutely beautiful. We walked around for two hours admiring the beautiful sculptures, flowers and water features. It was uncomfortably hot but there was enough shade and a shuttle service for those who wanted a ride. Time well spent.
Definately worth a visit, so much to see. Gardens are so beautiful, so much work and effort has gone into them. A different theme every so often , so you can keep going back.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not a big Wimner for me
REVIEW_BODY: The place is well maintained but very fake.and.crowfed I would not the time to go again. The light shows are pleasant but the walkway is quite chaotic

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to walk and enjoy the sun! FREE!!
REVIEW_BODY: Did the free walkabout. Took lots of pictures and enjoyed a nice day for FREE in the heart of Singapore. Worth your time!

REVIEW_TITLE: Could easily spend an entire day here!
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are amazing and so beautiful! We visited for the light show in the evening and again in the day time. If it wasn't for the heat, we could have spent all day exploring but still managed a few hours. So beautiful and definitely recommend visiting!
Unique Garden with two Aircon Dome. Cooling whilst you enjoy Landscape and Seasoning Flower. Recommended to go in late afternoon and leave after dark as different view

Highly recommended going to the Gardens its so special.
Fascinating trees and flowers could stay walking around for hours expect for the heat !
Must not leave Singapore before visiting .
An absolute must see. These gardens are amazing. Make sure to visit all of them. You will not be disappointed.

Absolutely Brilliant, we arrived late afternoon and went to the cloud forest, then the flower dome. We then headed down to the light show.
An amazing experience enjoyed by us all.
The waterfall inside the cloud forest was spectacular
It‚Äôs so pretty there and there a lot to do and see. Make sure you have enough time to do it all, I‚Äôd say at least 3 hours to savor it all
Went there at sunset so the lights come on, the views are spectacular, walkway was great, loved the light show, signage is brilliant.

REVIEW_TITLE: A lot more to see than expected
REVIEW_BODY:
When you say 'Gardens by the Bay', most people would conjure the giant supertrees in their minds, but the gardens is definitely a lot more than the towering, alien-like trees you see printed on postcards. On top of the two indoor domes which offers a great experience on it's own - that's also where their exhibitions are often held - there's a lot more things to do and see outside.

I haven't finished all the attractions of the area, but the outdoor cactus garden was definitely one of my favourites. Late noon at around 4pm, the natural light stream in from the open space as you roamed the gardens, offering a perfect place to snap photos. It may be a smaller area compared to other attractions, but it has a special place in my heart. I just love the tranquility there on that weekday late noon, as most visitors would tend to go for the indoor domes on top of the supertrees.

Definitely more people on the weekend, but there's pockets of areas which are also quieter.

A totally awesome experience, amazing flora and fauna from around the world sustained in a giant glass dome. From vibrant, colorful flowers to plants living in arid conditions. A must to visit when in Singapore

nice well maintained area, you can go any time during the day, but it's perfect at night of late evening, specially to avoid the heat. do not forget the light show @ 19:45 and 20:45 , it is something to see and enjoy
The two indoor domes are breathtaking and worth the admission alone . Views magnificent and flora etc were beautiful

This spectacular venue is a feast for the eyes in so many ways. You‚Äôre greeted by the enormous lighted trees and head to either the Cloud Forest, an education in ecosystems and planetary responsibility, or the Flower Dome, we were lucky enough to be there during the rhododendron festival. Navigating is so easy, but stay around for the light show at either 7:45 or 8:45. Find some space Underneath the large center tree, lay down and enjoy the colorfully wondrous 15 minute show. The Marina show is on the hour at 8 and 9, but going from one to the other in 15 minutes might be difficult. We did the Marina Sands water light and laser show at 8:00 which by 8:15 gave us 30 minutes to trek to the Gardens along with thousands of others. DO NOT MISS THIS ATTRACTION.
The Gardens are certainly different and not just for plant lovers!! Quirky installations and a nice walk from the Marina Bay precinct

REVIEW_TITLE: Incredible day out - the Cloud Forest Dome is a must
REVIEW_BODY: I went here with my husband and parents when visiting Singapore and had a surprisingly excellent day out! I wasn't sure what to expect and was concerned the gardens might be a bit of a tourist gimmick. However I was most definitely proven wrong! The gardens are wonderful and there is a lot to do. I would definitely recommend the tree top sky walk which are an incredible feat and also have excellent views of the city (but be warned if you have a fear of heights as the bridge is quite narrow in places). However the highlight for me was the Cloud Forest Dome. With a 35m information mountain and waterfall it truly is a sight to see! You could spend hours walking round and enjoying the scenery and plants. A nature lovers paradise!

Gardens by the bay can be accessed via bayfront stop on circle line Smrt. Once at the garden you can either just stroll and enjoy its natural beauty for free, or you can take the chargeable $3 each, unlimited use shuttle bus to the visitor centre and find out what else they also offer. One thing we enjoyed was the audio bus tour for $8 which takes you to on a tour of the gardens accompanied by detailed audio. The gardens are also home to the super trees skywalk way and the cloud dooms both of which are chargeable, but well worth a visit. There are various eateries around, toilet facilities, and the vast majority of the gardens are completely accessible. It even has free Wifi. Every evening at 19.45 and 20.45 they have an amazing free light and music show centred around the super trees, make sure you visit for free in the evening and watch in awe.

You have to visit whilst in Singapore, they are absolutely amazing. Give yourself plenty of time as they are huge and there is so much to see. There is a light show at night which is fantastic. Definitely recommend

This is an amazing place to visit and see how plants can be arranged into a wonderful display to walk through. We went during the day and it was very humid, night viewing would be absolutely amazing with all the lights. Sky walk is worth the money for some great photos if it is a clear day. Great food hall with an array of food cuisines, the hall is air-conditioned.

We visited the Cloud Forest and Flower dome as well as the Skyway at Supertree Grove. Both the cloud forest and flower dome were brilliant exhibitions with some beautiful displays. We spent 1-2 hours in each which was plenty.
The skyway at SuperTree grove was stunning and really worth the extra 8SGD, although wouldn‚Äôt recommend if you have a fear of heights.
We went back to the gardens at night as there is plenty you can walk around without admission and it‚Äôs truly stunning. The gardens also offer beautiful views of the MBS.

Interesting gardens, and the biodomes are great to work round.
Cafe was good.
Everywhere we looked in the flower dome there were sculptures, most made from driftwood, but really clever

Beautiful and a peaceful. Perfect place to sightsee and having a great time with family and friends. It‚Äôs a huge garden and some portions of the park are free like the supertree and surrounding. Not to be missed night time light show to enjoy music and lights.

The flower domes displays are changed regularly and the outer area of the garden is surrounded by beautiful view of the Singapore city center. For example, the scenic Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands Hotel is within 100 metres view.

Gardens by The Bay is absolutely amazing. There is so much to see. Wevwere fortunate to actually be up on the air walkway when the light show started. It was spectacular. You need a full day to see it all.
Well worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: A new way of entertaining and educating people about nature
REVIEW_BODY: An amazing place and a must visit place. Stay at least 2 hours to really explore the place. Futuristic design and fun to just walk through the gardens. Very worth the time and educational.

Fantastic gardens, well laid out. BIG.
You need all day to see it all and the night light and sound show is fabulous.
Two great pavillions with masses of flowers and plants.
The supertrees are amazing structures and the plants growing up them are really well established now.
A must when in Singapore.

Just walking through the garden is a great experience but I was lucky enough to pay a visit during lantern festival which added a further dimension to the place. I didn‚Äôt enter the domes this time but have been fortunate enough to do this in previous visits and they are truly magnificent.
The views of the bay and the Mandarin Bay Sands at night time are remarkable
Very nice garden, lots of plants and flowers around. Worth to visit night time to see lightning show.

Great place to see the beauty from the nature. Though it is a bit too cold if you are wearing shorts or skirts so put on long pants before visiting this place otherwise everything is excellent. A lot of beautiful flowers and many corners with cartoon figure like Winnie the Pooh. Would like to go back again but this time, I will bring a jacket or scarf with me.

This place is a true haven of peace in a busy city. There is so much to see here and you can stroll around at your own pace to take in such wonderful plants, trees and flowers. Just marvellous. Be careful as they do close one of the domes and then the other for routine maintenance so check on their website before setting out or booking your ticket on line to avoid being disappointed. Easy to get to, just take the MRT to Bayfront and follow the signs

As a keen gardener, I was very impressed with the Gardens. Amazing number of levels to this garden and equally amazing variety of plants. Any gardener would love this place. Restaurants nearby as well.

What an amazing place to see! You can walk around the garden and see the Massive Trees for free but you need a ticket to go into the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome- both well worth it (they are cheap also at $28. This is set against the incredible Marina Bay Sands Hotel WOW! Very easy to get to via, Taxi, Buses or Grab (Singapores answer to Uber)
Worth a visit! The ticket is well priced to visit all attractions. The flowers are beautiful. There is a light up show in the evening! Must see ...

The domes are well worth the money.
I baulked at the price the first time we visited, now I'm glad as it added so much to our second visit to Singapore!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Place in a big city
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful Garden in the Middle Of a megacity like Singapore is what I did not expected, The garden is big and a lot of space , great place for. A picnic. A great getaway from the craziness of Singapore

Came back for another visit on a return trip to Singapore and once again was not disappointed - the Gardens are stunning. We didnt pay extra this time to visit the domes but did go back up on the Skywalk which gives amazing views. Used the food court for drinks and ice cream which was good.

On arrival we discovered that the floral dome was closed. It was one of the reasons for our visit but we walked around the outside of the gardens instead of going into any of the domes. It is stunning and worth a visit. Plenty to see and experience outside of the domes. Really lovely experience. Went in the day but apparently beautiful at night with all the lights, Would recommend and next time will go into the domes.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing - must see while you‚Äôre in SG
REVIEW_BODY:
Definitely one to visit!
Only S$8 to walk on the sky bridge. Great views of Singapore and Marina Bay Sands. Evening light shows at 7.45pm and 8.45pm are spectacular and they‚Äôre free :)

The gardens are free to wander but certain attractions are ticketed around S$8-11 pers. The north end of the gardens are peaceful and an enjoy to wonder about. The south end is packed with exciting places to visit and can only be described by pictures.

This is an amazing space in the city of Singapore!! Where do you start there is do much to do!!

Did to limited time we did the flower dome and cloud forest. We had to return the next day for the cloud forest as it was shut on the day of our visit.

These are beautiful bio domes and so much work must go in to keeping them beautiful. Not a full day for us but a good few hours, plenty of food options too.

We returned on the evening for the light show which also was great and beautiful!!
Greenery scenery and wonderful garden. Recomended to go in the vening for that extra touch of lights!

REVIEW_TITLE: Stroll in the gardens while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful indoor gardens (Floral Fantasy) ....would compare to the hanging gardens of Babylon in the modern day

REVIEW_TITLE: Lots to see: free and admission-based
REVIEW_BODY: There are many things to see here, you can spend a full day here. There are many outdoor exhibits surrounding the large trees in the middle. There are also many indoor paid exhibits including Cloud Forest, Flower Dome, Floral Fantasy, and others. There are also a lot of restaurants, so you never have to leave!

REVIEW_TITLE: It's okay but not worth the price
REVIEW_BODY: The garden is awesome seriously well maintained and nicely decorated but forest and orchid which is paid is not worth cause the is a orichid garden which was much better. And if u want forest atmosphere u should visit the bird park it's awesome. Both forest and orchid are artificial with AC and all doest not have any natural touch but don't miss the garden lighting event in evening which is very good.

REVIEW_TITLE: A fascinating place suitable for family visits
REVIEW_BODY: I haven't had enough of it! The entire garden and the bay area are worth spending time on. I personally enjoyed the cloud forest the most but the rest of the garden are just as great.

If you visit Singapore you must go see The Gardens especially in the evening. It was the most amazing spectacle I have ever seen. The music is mesmerising and you will get fabulous photos...and it's totally free to watch...go go go

Since shopping is not our thing..everywhere you turn there is a mall!! the Gardens by the Bay was the highlight of our trip. Loved the Rain Forest dome, the light show was fun, but crowded. we where lucky to visit on the last night of the lantern festival..beautiful at night....I'd probably go in the morning when it's less hot and less crowded
Singapore bay area is the top point of singapore.such a lovely place it was gardens by the bay is lovely place and its amaze me

Beautiful and imaginative gardens with two amazing indoor tropical greenhouse zones that are something out of this world. The huge indoor waterfall is a sight to behold, as are the amazing tree canopies and walk. Absolutely worth a visit when in Singapore and very child friendly and easy.
The light show at night is worth seeing I think it starts about 8pm. The gardens are very nice to see.

We went for the 9pm light show & it was excellent. The gardens are really easy to get to & find from the MRT station. The light show was relaxing & beautiful. We'll definitely be returning to see the gardens in the daylight.
View is nice and very convenient as they do provide chargeable shuttle services (unlimited rides) around the Garden. My family love the walk around and the garden is clean.
Awesome experience.show organised was additionaly good. Liked the whole experience and ambience .a must visit!!!.

REVIEW_TITLE: The night lights are a must
REVIEW_BODY: Catch the green hop on hop of bus right to the gardens entrance. The flower and cloud done are sensational and a must see. Pay the extra. Stay for the night lights they are magical

REVIEW_TITLE: If only other countries followed Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful clean safe creative place full of passion and adventure and the trees at night that light up the skies are amazingly beautiful.

REVIEW_TITLE: Ticked this off the bucket list
REVIEW_BODY: A wonderful attraction that will not disappoint. I absolutely loved my visit to the gardens and so did my energetic small child. It is a stunning attraction that is well organised and easy to move around.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens of the world in one place
REVIEW_BODY: A great place to go especially if weather outside is too hot or wet. We could only see the Flower dome and outside gardens as forest dome was closed for maintenance, but even so a very enjoyable visit.
I'm no gardener but wow! What a slice of paradise in big town! So many plants at such a small place! Very very impressive

REVIEW_TITLE: good place for family, pay attention for when you coming
REVIEW_BODY:
good place for families and elder. they provide good access for disable and elder.

flower dome and cloud forest is a good place for relaxing. but beware of seasons, because when we coming there, there is a little flowers blooming.

garden rhapsody is a must. just enjoy the music and look at a lights dancing
A visual and sensory experience I will never forget. Easily accessible, not the cheapest place in town but well worth the effort
The gardens are well worth the day. The new Floral Fantasy area is magical and if you only have time for one display then see this one.

Best attraction in Singapore, includes flower dome,cloud forest, Super tree groove and Sky walk.They have light and sound show in evening at Super tree grooves,can visit skywalk in evening to enjoy light and sound show.Nearest MRT is Bay front,one exit is directly to the ticket counter of Garden.

REVIEW_TITLE: excellent during the day and night!
REVIEW_BODY: you must visit here during your stay. We were fortunate during the day and also on a tour at night. A must see in Singapore

We visited here over the f1 weekend and expected it to be very busy but it is so large you barely saw anyone until it started to be time for the light show.
We paid for the extra domes and the bridge which we thought was worth doing.
Lots of people just taking selfies or posing for photos rather than interested in the flowers, but each to their own.

Don't miss the free light show, definitely worth a watch. We sat on the grass and watched.

REVIEW_TITLE: World class attraction - lots free of charge
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore is justifiably proud of these Gardens which comprise two amazing greenhouses filled with exotic plants and trees and lots of open gardens with lawns, sculptures, flowers and lakes. While you pay to enter the greenhouses the gardens are free of charge. We were especially impressed with the series of thematic gardens which should prove fascinating for small children or the occasional switched on teenager. Look up to see parrots, fly-catchers, swifts and out on the Bay we were fortunate to get a good sighting of a White-Bellied Sea Eagle (which we understand is resident so perhaps not that rare, but great to see anyway). A great day out!

Gardens by the bay always amuse us with new additions, this time we able to catch up Floral Fantasy @ Bay, 4D ride was awesome too... price could have been cheaper as this attraction is smaller doom compared to cloud forest and flower doom

Packed, but lovely. The light show is at 7.45 for fifteen minutes, with sound. Queues for the high bridge were crazy, with one for paying and booking a slot in time, about 30 minutes, the a second to use the slot, which was running behind. So you may spend an hour in queues if you are unlucky. Be prepared. Otherwise entry is free, good choice of food outlets. Clean and organised.

If you want an amazing day in Singapore do not miss the Singapore Gardens.

Perfect in every senses. Enjoy

REVIEW_TITLE: Go for the evening light show
REVIEW_BODY: Nice gardens - mostly free - pay at the domes and on the walkway. Go before dusk giving time to walk around before it goes dark when you get an excellent free light show.

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning especially light shoe at night
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful place to visit really lovely. Worth paying little extra to go to the 2 indoor green houses,stunning

Overall experience was good as it was very cooling inside the dome. Probably the weather outside was pretty humid. Took photos of the lovely flowers and exhibits. The shuttle to & fro is kinda ex thou. As couples, we would rather walk through and enjoy the breeze. I would suggest if Gardens by the Bay can come out with ideas on the shuttle & ticket packages for locals. Nevertheless, it was awesome weekend for us!

Really stunning from start to finish, I wasn‚Äôt that keen nut tagged along with my wife!
Glad I did, the time and care it must taken to keep this area as beautiful as it is, is tremendous
Gardens by the Bay are so beautiful. The gardens are so breath taking. A must visit in Singapore. If you love flowers and forest, you must go here.
Words cannot describe this place, it has to be seen to believe. There is wonder at every turn a constant round of oohs and aahs.
